description:
This place is goood! If you love bacon come give it a try. There's some fun things on the menu. I was torn between the classic breakfast burrito and the breakfast sandwich. So I got both, because why not?!? But I have to say the breakfast sandwich was to die for. The bun is out of this world. Then the bacon jam and gooey cheddar cheese and bacon and fried egg. YUMMMM

DONT get me wrong, the breakfast burrito was good. But it was exactly as ordered a classic breakfast burrito. It was good. There's just something about that bacon jam and that bun on the sandwich. 

Oh and I got a Vietnamese iced coffee because I've been up since 4 AM, and I need a mid day/morning pick me up. 

There's a cute little mechanical pig you can ride. There's sweatshirts, hats and T-shirt's you can buy. And my food came out within 5 minutes. I highly recommend it!!!!
author: SA M.

description:
Wanted something quick and delicious for breakfast so we stumbled across Bacon Bacon and followed the reviews!

I ordered the breakfast sandwich and my fiancé ordered the breakfast burrito (with pork). 

Our food came out incredibly fast - sandwich had their special bacon jam, which really looked like pulled pork, but wasn't anything too special to me, though it seems to be a hit with everyone else! I don't have a huge sweet tooth, so I'm sure I would have enjoyed this more if I was more of a sweets fan. 

I loved the gooey cheesiness of this sandwich and the bun is really a star! The bacon, of course, was great. 

The sandwich was delicious, but not the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. I think the pricing is fair and though the sandwich may look small, it's the perfect amount of food. 

If you're a coffee fan, they have a pretty good Vietnamese coffee. I especially like the ice that comes in it. Almost slushy like. 

I'm definitely wanting to go back to try some more of their menu items. Bacon on everything is the way to go!
author: Cecilia C.

description:
Bacon Bacon was so good that we went 2 days in a row. We both ordered the breakfast sandwich, and I venture to say it's the best one I've ever had. The bun is fluffy and soft but slightly crispy around the edges, the egg is perfectly gooey in the middle, the bacon is crispy and thick and delicious, and the bacon jam is the most perfect balance of salty and sweet. Dear God it was amazing. 

The first time we went, we got iced Vietnamese coffee- YUM!! Creamy and strong and slightly sweet. The next day we got iced Havana coffee and it was somehow better than the iced Vietnamese coffee. Omg. A hint of cinnamon, a tiny bit of chocolate. And omgggg so good. Thank God we don't live in SF or we'd eat there everyday. 

Service was quick and the staff was great. The guy gave us the coffee recommendations each day and they surely didn't disappoint. We'll definitely go back next time we're in town!!
author: Ashley M.

description: I love bacon just as much bacon bacon loves bacon. The breakfast bowl and the burrito were great. Took awhile for the order but the wait was worth it. I ordered to-go and enjoyed it at home. The staff was friendly.
author: Christina M.

description: The breakfast burrito and breakfast sandwich were both amazing! The sitting area on the inside is a bit small and crowded during the morning, but it was still a pretty cozy place. My boyfriend and I both enjoyed it
author: Toni S.

description:
So I decided to get two burritos for lunch. Some of my coworkers thought I was being ridiculous, but I didn't care. (Apparently two burritos is too much?) I went ahead and did it anyways. Our office lunch delivery arrived by Caviar on Friday, April 20th around 12:30pm.

*Bacon Fries: French fries tossed in herbs, parmesan, spicy olive oil, homemade bacon bits, and bacon jam served with a side of blue cheese vinaigrette ($7.50)
*Breakfast Burrito: Scrambled egg, pork shoulder, bacon, avocado, and cheddar ($8.50)

I got the breakfast burrito, but also tried some of my coworker's bacon fries. Both items were chock full of bacon and meat. The burrito was stuffed with filling which I appreciated. Not sure if they offer hot sauces at the location, but this was great with some heat. (I always have multiple hot sauces at my desk.) The fries were good, but suffered from the transport time as they were soggy. Still good flavor. Though they didn't deliver the blue cheese vinaigrette, so I was missing that cheesy element.

Great breakfast burrito. If they were close to work, I'd get it more often. Maybe the next time Bacon Bacon rolls around as an office lunch option.
author: Elena N.

description:
Awesome little easy to miss spot on Franklin that serves incredible grilled cheese with bacon sandwiches and also excellent burgers.

Not much to look at, and they also serve pastries and other sandwiches, but the grilled cheese with bacon is a winner. Comes with bacon jam.

Burger was super delicious, juicy and awesome.

You can even ride on an old-school pig ride.
author: Bob K.

description: If you're in the neighborhood and looking for something to remind you of the bustling Manhattan street deli's then look no further. The New Yorker B.E.C is reminiscent of a classic bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich from the city that never sleeps. The one called the breakfast sandwich is delicious as well with bacon jam which is #tdf. I will definitely return if I'm in town. The view outside is phenomenal and the staff was friendly. The bread was quite delectable and the cheese was ooey gooey goodness.
author: Ron B.

description:
I've been eyeing this place for quite some time. I consider myself a bacon aficionado and I was failed. You can easily miss this place but it's on Franklin off Ashbury.

FYI street sweeping is 8 to 10 on Tuesday or Friday depending on where you park. 

I ordered the breakfast sandwich. The bacon jam was a major disappointment. It's nothing like your usual jam but more like burnt pulled pork. I got about 3 slices of mediocre flavorless bacon.

For $9 I could've made 4 tasty sandwiches! At least I can say I tried it. But don't waste your time.
author: Tiffany B.

description:
I'm feeling a little boarder line about the 4 stars - mostly I just don't feel like I know enough to appropriately rate it, but from the look of the menu  it seems like I would go with 4 if I knew it better.  

I got the classic breakfast burrito which was really quite good. Not the best breakfast burrito I've ever had but they did a good job of having simple flavors that each came out - I could taste the bacon, egg, and avocado clearly.

My husband got the Breakfast Burrito - which really just tasted like meat - so not as well balanced. Both were good sized - we came out full.

Good light in the space. Counter service. Very few people there when we went in, so it was quick, but might be different if it were busy. 

But don't go here if you don't like bacon - it's on pretty much everything, and is the point of going.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I came here with family for a quick meal before exploring the city. The restaurant is quite small, with about 4 bar-height tables and a longer counter that can all seat about 20 people.

I ordered the banh mi, while others in my party ordered the breakfast sandwich, cobb salad, bacon cheeseburger, and the cuban.

As we sat down, we all noticed the crazy amount of flies around our table. After a few seconds of looking around the restaurant, we noticed there were flies EVERYWHERE. They're all over the walls, merchandise (sweater, mugs, etc.) that they sell, napkins, cups, water cooler, everywhere. This made me lose my appetite really quickly.

While my Banh Mi sandwich was good, I couldn't get over all of the flies. Additionally, the bacon was really overcooked - not crispy but rather really hard and inedible.

There are restrooms, but you literally have to go through the kitchen and up some stairs across an extremely greasy floor.

Overall, I'd say the food is good, but the restaurant really needs to put some effort into cleaning the place. I understand that cooking bacon all day and having grease spatter everywhere doesn't help, but I would think it's health hazard to have grease on the floors and allowing flies to breed here. Gross.
author: Nina V.

description:
The bricks-and-mortar version of the popular Bacon Bacon truck, with the added advantage of having everything on the menu - and then some - that all too often runs out when offered at the truck itself.

The only drawback about this location is that it's not open in the afternoons and evenings. If you can get here earlier in the day, they serve breakfast items until closing, and they start serving lunch items at 11am. Familiar offerings from the truck, like the bacon double cheeseburger, bacon fried chicken sandwich, and bacon bouquet are all available here, are just as good, and are prepared quite quickly.

But, while you're at it, why not try some items you haven't had before? They've got a bacon banh mi here, and even salads and chicken, tuna, and turkey sandwiches that are enhanced with bacon. The breakfast sandwiches are to die for as well. I had a daily breakfast special that featured special cuts of cured bacon alongside egg, cheese, and aioli on an English muffin. It went down quickly, but boy was it scrumptious, and at least for me it was worth it.

Service is friendly, fast, and professional here, and there's a limited amount of seating at a window counter and at small tables. Endearingly enough, there's an amusement park ride-style pig that you can ride. A great option to have in the neighborhood (even if folks nearby complain of the bacon smell) and something work trekking to. It's not far from where the N-Judah MUNI line emerges from the tunnel in Cole Valley.
author: Vincent L.

description: Ordered from Bacon Bacon a few times for delivery. Two things that are consistent, the food is good and the delivery will always be 25-30 min longer than expected. I recently ordered right when they opened and still waiting an hour and a half to get my food. That said the food is good but doubt I will order delivery from them in the future. The original breakfast burrito is the best of the two. The pork burrito is ok but very greasy and not that much flavor-you will need hot sauce for sure. Should I feel like having food an hour and a half after orderring it, sure I'd order from them again.
author: Kaylin-Marie D.

description: Sooo good! Best burrito I've had in California. The egg was runny and perfect. The bacon bits were tasty. It had so much flavor, add salsa and ketchup! So bomb.
author: Brenda D.

description: Bacon Bacon is the PERFECT name for this eatery. The food was so tasty and the bacon jam was to die for! Sit back and relax with a latte at the window seat and enjoy the calm atmosphere!
author: Amber G.

description: This place is a great spot for rich and savory breakfast/lunch eats! The menu is obviously bacon-themed, but the vibe is more cool hole-in-the-wall diner than classic BBQ joint. The bacon fried chicken sandwich comes w/ bacon strips and bacon mayo, both of which were well-proportioned to the rest of the sando. Next time I'm in town I'm definitely gonna go back to keep eating my way through their menu!
author: Julien I.

description:
Attention Foodies!!!! This place is an absolute must. 

My husband and I stop by anytime we are in the Bay Area, even if it means going out of our way. My favorites are the Grilled Cheese (of course) and the Porky Fries. My husband trys something new every time and has yet to be disappointed. The service is always great and the vibe is always chill. 

If you're in the area and love yourself STOP BY!
author: Nila B.

description: Bacon bacon is the bacon lovers heavon! Bacon is in everything on the menu! We ordered the breakfast bowl which had eggs, bacon, pulled pork, onions and avocado, it was amazing! We also split the Mac and cheese bacon balls, they come with four and a chipotle dipping sauce! The restraint is small, maybe seating for about 20 or so within tables on four, but definitely delicious and worth going to try if you love bacon like I do.
author: Alicia D.

description:
This place is tucked in the midst of a neighborhood, but it's a good 15 minute walk from the nearest bus stop. 

My boyfriend and I decided to go here because we both love bacon and we weren't disappointed. This small cafe is all about the bacon, they even have a fun pig ride for kids and adults to ride on. 

My boyfriend and I decided to come here for breakfast because their lunch menu wasn't that diverse (it had mostly burgers) and we felt their breakfast menu was more interesting. I ordered some bacon tacos ($3) and my boyfriend got their breakfast bowl ($7). 

I also got a horchatta tea latte which was a equal balance of sweetness and cinnamon. It was probably the best I ever had and would probably come back again for it.

The bacon taco and breakfast bowl tasted almost the same with the filling. The filling was egg, bacon, and avocado which was good. The tortilla that came with the taco wasn't toasted and came with 2 mini tortillas so I ate some of my boyfriend's breakfast bowl. 

Overall, it was pretty decent meal and we enjoyed ourselves. The neighborhood is fairly safe, there's 0 homeless people loitering around and I saw many parents hanging out with their children around.
author: Kristi A.

description:
Bacon Bacon Bacon Bacon Bacon! Dank. Wet. Lit. Poppin. Smacks. This place has been bookmarked for a minute, because I LOVE BACON, I just haven't found a chance to try it until now. I'm a fan, I will be back. Price point is typical of an SF restaurant, so expect to spend about $10-15 for a meal.

Came in around lunch on a Sunday, place was packed, but saying that, there isn't much seating to begin with. I would say about 20 seats. But we stood in the short line and ordered pretty quickly. We got the bacon maple scone and the breakfast burrito (regular, not classic). We sat down at one of the tables and waited for our food. I started on the maple bacon scone, I love scones, but I've never been much of a fan of maple bacon, but let me tell you, it was pretty damn good! Not overly dry, not cakey, it was what I expect of a scone. It even had a pile of bacon up top with some maple drizzled over it. YUM. Finally our food came, and I took one look at that breakfast burrito and instantly fell in love. I love when you can see the distinct layers in food, especially my burritos. Much appreciated. Added the Valencia hot sauce (sits on each table, along with Ketchup, sriracha, and mustard). MA DAM. I only had to take 1 bite to tell it was incredible. Juicy. Took another bite to make sure it was real, and boy was it. My friend devoured it in a split, 2 seconds. I saw another table with fries and it looked like perfection as well, nice size with a crispy outer layer, that looked pretty soft inside. Anyways, I will be back to try the fries, the mac and cheese balls, and the chicken sandwich. They all looked sooooo good. I had eaten a late breakfast so I wasn't hungry enough to eat more, otherwise, I would have went in.

Food = dank
Price = normal
Service = good
Seating = limited
Parking = hills + limited
author: Eva C.

description:
Basic but artery filling good;-)

I  tried Swiss croissant which was disappointing as croissant was over cooked for my tastes. 

I decided for research purposes only to try the breakfast sandwich   Love has been found :-). 

The egg  oozes as you  you crunch into they bacon deliciousness.  





Yum yum
author: Phil W.

description: The best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. The bacon jam is amazing. Great little place!
author: Brian C.

description: What an amazing shock to the tastebuds.  The food is amazing and fresh, the half pound burger was incredible to the very last bite.  The French Fries has the perfect amount of seasoning.
author: Alexander A.

description: This place went downhill. My delivery order was missing most of the ingredients.  Breakfast Burrito lacked cheese and pork.  And my bacon egg cheddar sandwich just had egg in it.  Not ordering from them again.
author: reza n.

description:
If you believe that Bacon is good for you, you are guaranteed to be happy here. 
The place is small with limited seating but has an extensive menu offering snacks, sandwiches, and salads with bacon & cheese as the main ingredients.  

I really liked the Cubano- a hot sandwich with 3 kinds of pork, pickles, and mustard on ciabatta. 
The porky fries were piled with pork shoulder goodness. 
And the mac and cheese balls were ooey gooey delish! 

Random fun fact: There's a mechanical pig you should ride!
author: Mitzi G.

description:
Got delivery from here. It was pretty good but not as good as I expected. 

Breakfast burrito: pretty good with a lot of meat and a tasty toasted tortilla. Kinda wish they has some salsa on the side or something to balance out the flavor. 

Porky fries: pretty good with generous amounts of yummy pulled pork. Wish they gave a little more bacon. The fries itself were kind of dry. 

I would eat here again if I happened to be near it
author: Stephanie K.

description: The name says it all. Great for breakfast or lunch. Burgers, salad, breakfast burritos and bagels (and even pastries). This place is pretty tasty!
author: Alex M.

description: Best breakfast burrito with the best almond Chai latte I ever had. Using superlatives and I'm not American. Crazy
author: Kris D.

description:
During my visit to San Francisco, I went to Bacon Bacon twice for breakfast in five days.  I am blaming this on the fact that I was in a burrito state of mind while visiting.  But another factor is that their breakfast burritos are DELICIOUS.  I never imagined that combining bacon, pulled pork, egg, avocado and roasted red peppers in a burrito would equal the greatest meal on earth.  This is no exaggeration.  

For all my burrito lovers and bacon enthusiasts, Bacon Bacon is a must-try spot for all occasions.   
 
Unfortunately, I did not get to try any items off their lunch menu but that is on my food bucket list. Next time I head back to SF, this will be stop #1.
author: Laura H.

description: I ordered food from my hospital bed. I received cold bland food why add special instructions when the restaurant does even follow through with the original order never mind a request.
author: Will L.

description:
Staff was great, but the breakfast burrito was terrible.  As soon as I took a bite, grease started pouring out.  The burrito was in a little paper bag that was half filled with grease after a few bites.  I ended up throwing it away, because it was pretty gross.  

Perhaps I chose the wrong thing??
author: Sasha R.

description: The jam on the breakfast sandwich was the highlight. The egg was runny and the bread was fluffy. Wait time wasn't too long, but went on a Sunday morning and couldn't find seating. 8 dollars is a good price for a breakfast sandwich but it wasn't as filling as I would have hoped. The classic breakfast burrito was a little bland and had very little avocado. Would recommend if you're nearby but I wouldn't go out of my way to get it
author: Bito M.

description:
There are lots of places that have caught on to the bacon craze, but there still is truth to going to a place that focuses on bacon to get the best of the best.

While the trucks still work as great advertisers to new people to the concept, this original location in the Haight still is my go to place although the owner, Jim, spends more time at his bigger 3rd street location.  

While the menu has changed over the years, many of the classics are still there like the breakfast sandwich and breakfast burrito.  The Banh Mi sandwich recently returned to the menu at this location as well.  

Many menu items have returned after the historic battle with anti-swine neighbors that resulted in a nice plug on SNL, but the casualty is the pork belly sandwich I figure just became too expensive.

This location gets packed in weekends while the other location is more for the working crowd so be prepared to grab a cup of coffee and wait.  Parking can be difficult as well, but it is all worth it right?

What did I have this time around?  We split the breakfast burrito and sandwich.  

Yes they will always have me at Bacon!!
author: Erik H.

description: Over rated place was dirty and the manager was very rude. I ask to use the restroom he told me to wait they're very busy wtf! I'm a paying customer it's obvious this guy doesn't know how to treat patrons or knows how to manage. Food was garbage bacon burnt. Won't come back here !!!!
author: Joe K.

description: During a recent visit to SF while staying in the Haight a friend suggested going here and my group was not disappointed.
author: Dan R.

description:
Despite walking half a mile that felt like 10 due to the incline of the hills, this little spot called Bacon Bacon is heaven for those bacon lovers. By the way, who doesn't LOVE BACON RIGHT!!!  If it wasn't good for us then why did the lord put it on earth for us. Things that make you go hmmm.  

Anyways, we came for breakfast so i can only speak for that part of the menu. The breakfast burrito is to die for . So don't ask for the calorie count, JUST EAT IT!!! Your taste buds will thank you later. The rest of the menu must be good too, especially since it has bacon. Sandwich with bacon, burrito with bacon, fries with bacon, SALAD, yep, with bacon.  So don't miss out on this place if you are a bacon lover. 

2 thumbs up . Best bacon spot ever!!
author: Andy R.

description:
Order: Cuban sandwich and Mac and cheese balls 

The mac and cheese balls were a little salty dipped in the sauce. Not over powering but when I took a bite my partner and I both said it without thinking. 

The Cuban was to die for the meat was tender and felt like it was cooked for 8 hours plus. The bread was nice and toasted the bell peppers were a nice twist 

This place is a nice spot to drop by for a bite on your way to somewhere. 
Sitting is nice also.
author: Christopher S.

description:
Amazing. Bacon Bacon. A must visit spot. 

Did i mention it was amazing?

So much delicious food, i wish my stomach was bigger so i could ingest more delicious bacon. 

I've never had a bad experience here, and i doubt i ever will.
author: Dave B.

description: I was craving bacon after an early morning flight into SF and behold this gem! I got the Frederick and was NOT disappointed! Phenomenal salty flavors. Omg. Bacon lover's dream spot. Walk up & order.
author: Debra B.

description: Anything you order here will fill you up! There is a lot of food for your buck. For two people you can share fries and each person can get a sandwich. Another wonderful brunch place since they open at 11am and breakfast is served late. They're Havana coffee is also delicious. Iced coffee with condensed milk!!! I will definitely be coming back for some coffee and breakfast.
author: Melissa M.

description: If I could leave no stars I would. The service here is horrible. The cashier kept running in and out of the restaurant. At one point he got into a car and drove off. I ordered 3 sandwiches, almost veggies with No Bacon. I was very adamant about NO Bacon. We waited well over 10 minutes. When we left with the sandwich's, I asked again "no bacon, right?" And was assured that there was no bacon. When I got back to the house. BACON.  I understand the name is Bacon Bacon. But the order should have been right. The cashier argued with me when I brought hem back. His attitude was poor. I will never go back. Which is a shame because I love their coffee.
author: Leah M.

description: Such a great place. Have been multiple times for breakfast and once for lunch now. I had the fried chicken sandwich and was so great! The flavors were on point and the chicken was nice and crisp. Also had the fried Mac and cheese balls. This obviously isn't a place to try if eating healthy. The breakfast is also great but the breakfast burrito has always been so extra greasy I wouldn't recommend that. Will definitely be back sometime tho!
author: Emily F.

description:
This place is overhyped, super bummed it wasn't as good as what I dreamed about. I've been to both locations. The one in Haight I got the Cuban and there was a decent amount of meat on there but it was super dry. The meat was good though. My husband got the Bird and he had the same problem, not enough sauce. 

When the King St. location was open I had the Breakfast Burrito and that was good. It was super heavy and I felt like my heart was going to stop after I was done. It wasn't anything outstanding, just a typical breakfast burrito. 

There is no parking ... so good luck. Pricing is average.

If this was the only place to eat in the area I'd go here again but it's not a spot I crave or keep wanting to go back too.
author: Mal L.

description: Got the breakfast burrito and it was unfortunately a little, WET, which is great for certain things....but not my egg filled burrito.  Maybe I just caught them at a bad time because everything on the menu looked good.  Must come back to give it another try but for now...be careful of the breakfast burttitooooo
author: Vince L.

description: Great grilled cheese bacon sandwich.  I had it for the first time yesterday and it was fantastic. I'll be coming here again.
author: Henry V.

description:
Food: 
Breakfast bowl: tender pork, delicious avocado, and tons of flavor in this bowl. So yummy! 

Ambiance: 
Decent amount of seating. Ideal for groups of 4-5 at the high tops. Open and clean with nice, large windows. 

Location: 
Parking in this area can be tough. We came early (before 8) and had a little bit of a walk. Maybe it's better later on when some more people have left for work?

Service: 
Friendly and prompt! No complaints here :)
author: Susan G.

description:
Ain't nothing like a good breakfast burrito!

That being said, it takes a bit longer than usual for your food to be prepared. For counter service, I would generally expect 10 minutes tops for my food to be ready; here, it took probably 15-20. 

Okay, so maybe I was a little impatient, but when that glorious golden burrito landed, I was filled with delight at every bite. 

The food here is delicious, but they would improve on their service time. Still a solid choice for all your bacon-y cravings!
author: Fiona F.

description: I had been to the food truck so said I would give the bricks and mortar place a go! We didn't have breakfast... had the burger which was excellent and my partner had the salad... also excellent... the place is a little rough and ready... but the staff are friendly... if in the neighbourhood it's worth it... I will give breakfast a go next time!
author: Reg B.

description:
WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE?! The name of Bacon Bacon is like... meat that is so epic it just echoes when you say it once. My boyfriend and I live in the Castro District, so we decided to take a nice Sunday stroll here.

We ordered the Breakfast Sandwich and Breakfast Burrito to split, then the Porky Fries and Bacon Chili to save for later - yes we were feeling ambitious that day. Our food seemed to take forever to prepare. There is also not a lot of seating, so you might have to wait around for a bit and snatch a table when someone leaves. In the meantime, we enjoyed a tasty Hot Havana Latte.

The wait was so worth it though. The Breakfast Sandwich was my favorite out of all those choices. The egg was messy but the flavor was perfect. How could such a simple sandwich be so good? Would recommend. The other foods we got were also good. Would not recommend saving any of these for later like I tried to do.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Tried the breakfast bowl. Really yummy, but it felt like half a serving, for $7. Coffee was alright. Small space, but at least they have a restroom (upstairs).
author: D M.

description:
Everything Bacon!

I ran into an article in the Chronicle about Bacon Bacon opening at a new location near AT&T Park. I had never heard of them, so I thought I check them out at their current location in Upper Haight and that is how we ended up having breakfast here.

The coffee is very good (BIG plus) and the sandwiches are great, but I went with the Breakfast Bowl. It is small, but delicious and filling. The space is small and has limited seats, so get there early or be prepared to take out. The young man behind the counter was very personable and nice.

If you want a taste of delicious bacon, visit Bacon Bacon!
author: Afshin A.

description: The breakfast sandwich with avocado added vs breakfast burrito - definitely get the sandwich as it'll have more texture. The burrito was a bit too mushy. Perhaps if they added some crispy bacon or French fries (; it'll give it a little more texture with the delicious flavor.
author: Jess W.

description:
Yumm!! Definitely a fan of Bacon Bacon. They used to be food truck but now they opened a restaurant! The staffs are super nice, food comes out fast, great quality and they sell T-shirts! I actually got a shirt that made me laugh, "You had me at bacon" lollll! 

I came here for breakfast with my roommate and we ordered the breakfast burrito and the breakfast sandwich. We both were not too cray about the breakfast burrito even though they recommend the best thing on the menu. It didn't have much spices and could use more ingredients. As for the breakfast sandwich, it was bomb diggity! The egg was cooked perfectly (yoked) and the bun was sweet and tasteful. Definitely recommend the breakfast sandwich over the burrito. 

Overall, great breakfast spot and they also do lunch as well. I'll come back here again.
author: Jenn L.

description:
My boyfriend actually found this spot because we were both craving breakfast sandwiches and we absolutely miss Eggslut down in Southern California, so this was pretty much as close as we could get to eggslut (minus the whole menu being about eggs). Parking is EXTREMELY difficult, so I would recommend either taking public transportation here or finding parking a couple blocks away.

My boyfriend and I both ordered the bacon breakfast sandwich because we wanted something that had a runny egg in it,plus we were both intrigued by the bacon jam it had. We ended up taking it to go because we were double parked and luckily, Haight and Ashbury wasn't too far away. We drove over there and enjoyed our breakfast sandwiches, but my boyfriend ended up forgetting that the egg was going to be a runny yolk and it exploded all over his car + pants (LOL). The breakfast sandwich was VERY light, especially with the amount of bacon in this sandwich. Definitely something worth getting in the morning! 

The second time we came here,we wanted to order something off the lunch menu and we ended up getting the fried chicken sandwich. I have to say that I wasn't expecting the sandwich to be so big. There was TONS of fried chicken in that sandwich and to be honest, I couldn't finish it. I ended up getting a bit tired of the taste towards the end because of the bacon jam and the fried chicken, but honestly, it was still a pretty good sandwich (I can only eat half of it at once though).
author: Trisha L.

description:
Been seeing this place pop up in my search feed on yelp and decided to finally give it a try! I've been searching for breakfast burritos, but when I came here I ended up getting something else. Would give it 3.5. Will come back to try their breakfast burrito though!

Ordered:
-bacon fried chicken sandwich: this sounded so good and I was super excited to try this, but when I finally got to it, I thought it was okay. Chicken was a little dry, but that's not surprising for a fried breast. The bacon wasn't crispy, wonder if I could have asked for them to make it extra crispy? I think I would have loved this if it had brown sugar/maple glazed bacon. That's just my opinion though~

-CA bacon bbq burrito: boyfriend got this. It was pretty good! I liked this a bit more than my sandwich. We both agreed that this needed more bbq sauce.

-mac and cheese balls: nice and crispy exterior, yummy mac and cheese goodness interior. Can't go wrong here.

Service was nice and friendly and seating can be a little limited during lunch rush, I'm sure. If dining in, you can clean up after yourself and put away your plate and cups off to the side of the register. Parking can be a little bit of a pain too. We had to drive around a little bit and ended up parking a few blocks away. Good to walk off the meal though, taha~
author: Tina N.

description:
This is a small spot my friends and I stopped by before heading to Golden Gate park. We came around 1pm on a Saturday and managed to snag the big table in the back, but I think that depends a lot on luck. Hearing that the breakfast burritos "were to die for," my friends and I went for that and the Banh Mi. 

After watching a number of customers behind us get their orders first (maybe because they were to-go? still unknown...), we finally (and slowly) got all our orders. The sizes of the portions are definitely overwhelming and filling, but I think that the breakfast burrito is average at best. I'm not usually a fan of bacon, but I was a bit disappointed to see that the bacon at a place known for bacon was not very impressive. 

Overall, the service was slow, the food was average, and it's a tight squeeze to find a place to sit. Would think about it before going here again.
author: Cindy N.

description: Came across this place while visiting San Fracisco.... OMG, it was soooo Good! Had there Breakfast Sandwich and it was to die for! Bread was fresh and fluffy, the bacon jam was amazing. Very flavorful . Their Mac n Cheese Bacon fried balls are a must!
author: Eva Y.

description: Absolutely will be visiting this place again!!! Such a welcoming, chill atmosphere and their hot sauce just proves the authenticity! Love this place!!!
author: Cassie B.

description:
This place is pretty underwhelming as a breakfast spot. Putting aside my dislike for over-the-top bacon worship, I just don't feel like Bacon Bacon nails any of their dishes. 

The breakfast sandwich is okay (good bun, good "bacon jelly"), but not substantial enough for me as a stand-alone. Maybe it could benefit from a sausage patty or something. 

The breakfast burrito is also serviceable and more filling, but less appealing/satisfying than what you'd get at most Mexican restaurants. I feel like their pulled pork texture doesn't jive well w/ the rest of the burrito. 

Final nail that keeps me from hitting Bacon Bacon breakfast more often is that they put crushed ice in their coffee instead of cubed -- watery iced coffee really gets my goat (or pig)!
author: Ryan D.

description: This place is as bacon as it gets! I was looking for a good breakfast spot in the area and happened to find this gem super close by! Being a bacon lover, I had no idea on what to order since everything on the menu sounded good. Ended up getting the breakfast burrito and it did not disappoint! A little pricey (as expected) but definitely would order again!
author: Joshua H.

description:
Solid place!  When -every- dish (well almost) has bacon, what's not to love?

Nestled in a nice area on the edge of Haight-Ashbury, Bacon Bacon is just a fun place to be. The menu is very broad, and I was torn between several things. Cheaper than I expected, though portions were not especially large. Expect to order a few things if you're hungry. Atmosphere was nice, and you can eat with a great view of a neighborhood you probably can't afford ;)

I definitely recommend the breakfast bacon taco and the BBQ burrito. Both were amazing and quickly quelled my hunger. The bacon grilled cheese was also worth the trip. I love how many of their dishes incorporate pork belly or pulled pork as well as bacon. ALL THE PORK. Coffee wasn't bad either.

Can't wait to return for another weekend craving!
author: Ryan S.

description: This is my second time eating here. I didnt like the bacon chedder scone. It reminded me of cornbread. Bacon cheese burger was good but def get the double. Not much meat on a single. Good fries
author: Candy K.

description: Breakfast Burrito was da bomb! Loved it, and not a potato in sight! Just pure meat and eggs. Well worth the journey from downtown SF. Saturday morning and no line. Highly recommend!!
author: Mark-Jenni E.

description: The burrito was wayyyyyyyy too bacon-y for me on the first try. I had to ask for a lot more eggs and less meat on the second go (can't handle the 20:1 ratio they put originally) and that was excellent. Great place!
author: Joe D.

description:
So I walked in on a whim for a breakfast burrito after a long night of work. I was not disappointed. 

The burrito is mostly meat too so I was so full afterwards. And the pulled pork was delicious. Only regret was not eating it with hot sauce!!
author: Michael P.

description:
So good! Great customer service. 

Maybe I set my expectations too high because I saw the word bacon twice, but I kind of wanted more options and to be a little bit more wowed by their feats of bacon making, you know what I mean?

The coffee I had was extremely good. 

Really nice ambiance.
author: Casey K.

description:
I went to their physical location with my sisters. First off there is basically no seating in the place so don't try bringing more than 2-3 people. It's going to be difficult to find seating. And the seating is bar stools (no backs) so it's not the most comfortable of dining experiences.

The food itself is okay. I got a bacon egg and cheese sandwich. Beware the egg is not scrambled so if you're not careful the liquid yolk will spatter everywhere! Like what happened to me.

I didn't think the sandwich was anything special. I didn't think the bacon jam really added anything to the dish. It might be because I like my eggs scrambled instead. I have eaten better sandwiches sorry!
author: Danielle C.

description:
The Bacon-Bacon truck has to be one of my favorite stops from the trip to San Francisco with Yelps ACRONYM squad! We visited the SOMA StrEAT food park on our first day in the city and were graciously treated to several tickets to use for our meals and drinks. The Bacon Bacon truck lured me in with their bacon fried chicken sandwich (consisting of : bacon *duh!*, panko encrusted chicken breast, spicy slaw and bacon mayo!!). 

Service was fast, friendly, and attentive and I had an amazing conversation with the guy who was taking orders. He recommended several places for me to check out during my weekend in San Fran as well as provided recommendations for items to try from the other trucks in the lot. 

My sandwich was HUGE and received a ton of "ooohs" and "aaaaahs" from the other ACRONYM members as I sat down to devour it. The chicken breast was perfectly cooked and juicy and the bacon mayo left me craving more. 

The Bacon Bacon truck was able to show me that you don't need fancy ingredients to make one hell of a sandwich - all you need is a little love, and a lot of bacon!
author: Zoie H.

description:
"We finally made it." When we arrived on foot, he turned to me and said it slowly. He looked impressed, as if he did not believe that we'd ever make it out here. I remembered distinctively that day when I sent an online review of this place to him, and said, "you should go there." He replied back "Yes plz" but he never came here on his own even though this was damn close to his house. He was waiting for me to go with, as it turned out. 

But you see, I had seen their food truck in SoMa, I never paid much attention to it really, until a nice article about the store front showed up. I go where the reviews tell me to go. I'm a follower and not a leader. And I like to stereotype.  You know how some people stereotype Asians, I stereotype the Midwesterners. If you announce to me that you are from Nebraska, Indiana and Iowa, I immediately think you are raised on a farm, harvested corn and ate bacon until you can't stand it any more and then you headed west. I'd be wrong, of course, but I'd be right about him liking bacon, who is one of those (wrongly) stereotyped Midwesterners.

I knew because we had spent weeks last winter discussing bacon. Yes I like to spend time pontificating bacon. 

The restaurant is hidden among a bunch of stately Victorian homes, "stately" maybe an overstatement, it's pretty and pristine, and well maintained. Fredrick street is residential, except for Bacon Bacon, there were just bunch of Victorians. You'd think you'd smell the bacon from miles away but you'd be wrong. The store front is not very large. I missed it, he spotted it. Once inside, you'd feel that it's got a bit of an odd combo: They also serve espresso drinks, fanciful ones with their own blend of coffee beans, along side with down home cooking of bacon themed sandwiches.

For $7, you get a gourmet breakfast sandwich with googy eggs and bacon strips. For a little more, $9, you get the stack of meats piled on with bacon as one of the meats, inside of a fresh roll, yes that's the Cuban and it was wonderful. If you are into pork belly alongside of your thick cut strips of bacon.

Americano for the after this-piggie-went-to-the-market meal drink. Foamed just right.

Inside dining spots are very sparse, but, on a weekend holiday, one could withstand a little bit of a wait and your patience will be rewarded with the front window counter space, where you get the view of the pretty Victorian homes across the street. Turning the other way, you'd often see someone riding the electric pig doing the photo op thing. Earlier, I had mistaken it for the horsey until he asked me to get on top of it like every other tourist. No, thank you, I look ridiculous enough without hopping on that piggy. 

I don't think I've ever had a sandwich that tasted this good. 

"It's worth the wait." He concluded. 

Is it? Must all good things in life withstand the agony of wait? Now it's been found, can we declare every day be bacon bacon day from here on out?
author: Victoria E.

description:
I've been to Bacon Bacon twice now - once for the California Burrito and once for the breakfast burrito. Honestly, I found both to be underwhelming and lacking flavor. I think most disappointing was that the bacon both times was average. A place called Bacon Bacon - you'd think the bacon would be top notch! It wasn't.

I'll eat here again (probably hungover) because it's easy and local to me, not because it's particularly good.
author: Russ S.

description:
Went there with my daughter and husband as it is a neighborhood place. My daughter was startling and we asked to get her order first.After waiting 30 minutes, the cashier told me their printer was not working and the order had to be redone. Then when
the food came out, it was boxed to go. My daughter asked for the bacon on the side and that was not done. The cashier was rude for messing up our order. $42 for 2 burgers and a mediocre salad is a rip off!!! The french fries cane afterwards. Very disappointed. We want to support local businesses and understand why people would want to go to bigger chains of customer service is do abominable.
author: diana b.

description:
Bacon? Bacon.

There's a reason they say bacon twice in their name, because they take this delicacy veryyy seriously. Everything on their menu is chock-full of bacon! From the salads, to the wide array of their sandwiches, to even their desserts and drinks (my friend ordered the Mexican Hot Chocolate which was topped with bacon, a fun and delicious treat!)! 

The place is rather tight, but what they lack in size, they make up for in the close care and attention they have for their customers and food. The service was very kind and helpful, and our food came out at a very fast time! 

Now onto the bacon. we ordered the Cuban, the Bahn Mi, and the Bacon Grilled Cheese, which all came in a fairly large serving, so we were all fine sharing. While putting bacon in a Bahn Mi and bacon "jam" in a grilled cheese may sound unusual, it made our dishes surprisingly much more savory and added that salt component without being too overwhelming. There is so much precision to crafting all these dishes with bacon as to not be excessively greasy, salty, or fatty, and the people here have perfected their recipes so much, it makes me want to come back and try everything, especially their desserts!

While seating may be sparce, the atmosphere is very fun as there are photographs of satisfied customers all on the walls, and we (and you!) will be glad to be on it as well.
author: Kyrie S.

description:
Umm excuse me did I tell you to smile?
I saaaid did I tell you to smile.
Did I give yo dreezyazz PER-MISS-ION to be
Mzfzn infectiously joyous w every word u say
And to serve me such radscrumplicious
Brekko #DeanFspiration while we all
Rock the eff out to the 1st Weezer album?
Oh I didn't?
See that's what I thought. Tripsta.
author: Dan B.

description: The food here is decent, and everything tastes fine.  But.  When 'The Fries' that are supposed to come with 'herb and Parmesan' come with a negligible amount of both, what am I really paying 4 dollars for?  A small thing of greasy fries?  Pretty disappointing
author: Dylan W.

description: What a fantastic place! I stop by every time in in San Francisco. The name says it all but there's more. I cannot think of a better place to recommend for a good sturdy breakfast in SF!
author: G N.

description: I ordered the Cobb salad via Postmates, and it was delicious. Pork belly, pork shoulder, bacon, guac and a good Cobb dressing.
author: Scott M.

description: Ordered takeout from here- a breakfast burrito and bacon fries. Was unfortunately thoroughly unimpressed. The burrito was missing avocado included in the description and overall flavor was meh. The fries were also not so great and they forgot the blue cheese dip.
author: Brittany B.

description: Meh, long wait time, not cheap. Apparently the breakfast sandwich and the burrito are pretty good, my breakfast bowl was super disappointing, didn't finish it.
author: Nicolas D.

description:
You'd figure a place with 4.5 stars after 225 reviews would be a good place to try some chow. You would be remiss to think otherwise.  OMG. This place is the absolute best burger in town.  I satisfied my urge for some healthy greasy options by going here.  As a native Chicagoan escaping the cold for a few weeks into the sunny skies of SF, I found this to be an awesome joint.  

The man behind the counter was helpful and very polite.  The place closed at 3pm, and I walked in at 2:55 and got a burger and coke.  It was delightful.  Minimal greasy and goo, well cooked, but not overdone.  The bund was soft and delicious and the whole thing went down fast.  

You won't get attitude or negativity here, and you will definitely leave with a smile on your face.  The Uber driver was late picking me up tho. That guy sucks. I almost passed out on the sidewalk from food bliss.  Be careful ;)
author: Brian P.

description: Note: Food truck by Market Street review. This hit the spot! I Ordered the California BBQ Bacon Burrito and it was absolutely fantastic. It was ready almost instantly and the staff were very friendly. I ended up eating it before I even got back to my desk at work. The bacon was crispy and it had a perfect blend of pulled pork and cold slaw. The BBQ was sweet honey and it blended perfectly. Mixed in with French fries this was literally the first time I've almost gone back to get seconds from a food truck. I enjoyed this immensely and will definitely return again!
author: James R.

description: Small little place, Great bacon wrapped pork breakfast burrito... in a historic building near haughty-asbury
author: Pat D.

description: The best breakfast burrito I've ever had!! Plus great coffee and customer service. Definitely coming back!
author: Michelle F.

description:
I love BACON.  So does my son.  He can have it everyday if he had the choice. 

I've been wanting to try Bacon Bacon for some time but have never had the chance, until today.  My mom and I were in the area and were a little hungry so we decided to stop by Bacon Bacon.   It was just around breakfast so we decided to stick with the breakfast menu which I regret now!  I think I may have ordered the wrong items because upon reading other Yelper reviews, they all seem to love it. 

My experience on the other hand was just OK.  My mom ordered the  breakfast sandwich and I ordered the breakfast burrito.  We split both of the items we ordered.  
Honestly I thought my sandwich was pretty bland and the burrito was just OK.  That won't deter me from coming because they had other items that I definitely want to try. 

The restaurant is fairly small but there is definitely room to sit and eat.  They also have a mechanical pig that your little boy or girl can ride! I don't know if I would sit on that thing as an adult with the fear of breaking it. But it's a cute, kitschy thing to have in the restaurant.  They also sell Bacon Bacon shirts, chocolate dipped bacon, cookies and popcorn which I skipped out on but may try in the future. 

Overall verdict: I will come back to try the rest of the menu.  The breakfast items I did order were just OK.  But I love bacon, so this place is definitely a plus in my book.
author: Christine P.

description: I was in San Francisco for a bachelorette party. I had dropped a pin on my map so I knew where our Airbnb house was. After dropping the pin, I was looking at the surrounding area and noticed "Bacon Bacon." Who doesn't love bacon? I knew I had to check it out! Cute little cafe. I had ordered two breakfast tacos, which had scrambled eggs, chopped bacon, avocado, cheddar cheese, banana peppers, and hot sauce on a corn tortilla. Soooo good! Lots of people constantly coming in to eat or pick up an order.
author: Nina T.

description:
WHAT?

I was looking up places to eat on a Saturday morning and found Bacon Bacon. I've seen their truck various places, but I've had a few of their dishes. Found the breakfast sandwich was a popular dish here so I figured - Saturday morning with nothing to do, so i decided to take a bus and get there. 

The breakfast sandwich was delicious! The egg was definitely really gooey and messy, but oh so good.  Bacon, bacon jam - definitely added to the amazingness of the sandwich.  Amazing and loved it. 

Must try some of the lunch sandwiches next time.

Protip: breakfast sandwich is messy, but OH SO GOOD
author: Nina Y.

description:
I love bacon, and I want to love this place, but I always leave a little disappointed.  I've been there on three occasions, and each time the bacon was chewy and flabby.  I realize this is a matter of opinion, but I think most people prefer their bacon slightly on the crispy side.  I find their bacon underdone.

Food takes quite a while to arrive, so perhaps they're cooking each batch to order.  It takes time to perfectly cook bacon.  Perhaps they could pre-cook a bunch and warm it up as necessary.  It'll taste just as good.
author: Lucullus L.

description:
Apparently I'm #2 when it comes to Yelp check-ins, so it's about time I wrote a review! 

Bacon Bacon is one of my go-to for quick weekend brunch, especially since I live so close. Not only do they have an amazing selection of bacon-products, but it's also not crazy expensive as brunch can sometimes be. My favorite is the breakfast burrito, and the porky fries are also bomb if you're hungry enough! 

They have a limited amount of seating (4 tables and a bench), so weekends can get a little hectic if you're planning on eating there. But luckily service is pretty fast so people are in and out quickly!

Definitely a must-try if you love bacon. Also try their food truck if you're at off the grid!
author: Tracy C.

description: We ordered two burritos, filled with pulled pork, pork belly, coleslaw  and french fries. My sil had the fried chicken sandwich. He loved it. I  had the grilled chicken sandwich. I  would love to go back and try the porky fries. Fun atmosphere and excellent staff. Deliciousness
author: Alicia H.

description: Upped your game at the store Bacon Bacon. Interior is open and inviting, not to mention spotless. Great prices on coffee drinks that taste top notch. Like the fact that vegetarians can eat here too due to thoughtful menu.  And of course it is still a temple to the fatty meat we all love. Great breakfast AND lunch spot. I will be back. Btw nice counter service today so keep that guy around.
author: Miss F.

description:
Stopped by here after a morning of hiking around Mt. Sutro.  It's a small little cafe space with lots of bacon on the menu.

I order the LGBT (heh) sandwich, which consists of lettuce, goat cheese, bacon, and tomato.  Also picked up a bag of chips, a lemonade, and a chocolate dipped chocolate chip cookie topped with chopped bacon.

Best idea I've ever had.  This had such a great combo of flavors, and, hello, it has bacon.  BACON THE EVERYTHING!

I know it's a fad/trend, but it certainly helps that it tastes so amazing.  Bacon has been a staple of great food for a while, and a bacon everything place may (or may not) be sustainable forever, but why not enjoy it while we can?!  Such a great way to spend your lunch!
author: Jes G.

description: Tried to breakfast burrito, should of got more bacon! Filled with pork and all the goodies. Tasted fresh, wish there was a salsa that came on the side but that's just me
author: Rainier V.

description: Great place to have breakfast at. Though seating is definitely sparse, if you're looking for a great breakfast sandwich or burrito with iced coffee to go, this place is perfect. Like the food truck, this place is happening!
author: Juan T. K.

description:
We drove from the peninsula into SF just to try their breakfast sandwich.  Moving from NYC, we've been dying for a good hearty grilled breakfast sandwich but haven't been able to find an ideal one yet.

Their breakfast sandwich was unique and quite good but I still wouldn't write home to about it.  The fun surprise was when my fiancé and I both took a first bite and the perfectly cooked fried egg oozed over our hands. Delicious food is meant to be messy!  It was good. You could taste the bacon jam and the slices of bacon were just the right thickness. I just wish the brioche was a little smaller, otherwise wish the proportion of sandwich ingredients was more balanced. I'd say the bread : ingredient ratio was about 1:1, I think it should be more 1:2 to get more flavor and texture. 

Good sandwich overall, we'd probably come back if in the neighborhood next time.  

The cafe is cute. Ride the pig and snap a photo for the wall!
author: Angela K.

description:
LOVE their Bacon Bouquet - I get it every time I see their food truck even if I'm not hungry because #bacon. Their food is generally pretty fantastic, but I have a few gripes. I've had their fried chicken sandwich a few times and I like it (would give it a solid B), but it honestly leaves a bit to be desired. I wish it had a fried egg or more moisture in the chicken. Also, their garlic fries get a B for the same reason as the sandwich, they're missing that extra oompf. Bonus points for their side salad and dressing though, it's on point!

Next time I go hear I'm getting their breakfast sando, I hear it's the best one in the city.
author: Morgan M.

description: Best bacon and grilled cheese in Nor Cal. We made over an hour drive for this craving and it didn't disappoint. The super friendly service makes it even more enjoyable. This is an experience you must have!
author: Cristina O.

description: Found this place on trip advisor and decided to check it out! As you would guess with the name of the restaurant, everything pretty much has bacon in it. I got the bacon and pulled pork burrito which was pretty good! It looks small, but it's much more filling than you would expect. Had a glass of fresh orange juice on the side also. Perfect quick breakfast meal! The restaurant is pretty small and there is limited seating, so if it was a busy day you might need to take it to go. Also, it's in a residential area so good to walk to but no parking besides street parking. Neat little hole in the wall restaurant! Would definitely come back if I was in the area. Staff was very friendly.
author: Jordan A.

description:
Service was friendly joint was clean... Wished we were able to try their lunch fare during the morning hours ;( 
Breakfast was not knock your socks off I have to come back... 
Will return for lunch and update this.
author: Liz N.

description:
It's all about the bacon.  I love them just for that.  I ordered the bacon bouquet.  4 strips of their friggin delicious delicacy, all wrapped up in a paper cone.  I also ordered the Mexican hot chocolate.  Yes, it has bacon, too.  Here's what happened...

I took one bite on my way out.  Handbag hanging from the crook of my elbow, hot choc in one hand, my cone of bacon w a bunch of napkins in the other...
I couldn't stop eating this bacon.
It was a block to my car, & I was inhaling this bacon like someone that had just gone without food for a couple of days.  I get to my car, & resume.  Really, just a shameless display.  All customary dignity & decorum out the window.
And you know what?  I'd do it again.

Do you have any idea how well hot chocolate & bacon go together?  A perfect marriage.  

Bacon Bacon is back.  Love.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Bacon Bacon is a great casual breakfast & brunch spot, I couldn't be happier to live as close to it as I do.

My favorite things to get consistently are the breakfast burrito, the cup of chili to-go, and iced almond milk lattes.

Their sandwiches are also very good!

I love the staff and also their use of compostable materials. 

Also, mochas with bacon crumples on top!!!
author: Megan D.

description: This place was good. I got their breakfast burrito, which I expected to be more egg-y but instead it was full of meat...I guess that's what you expect from a place that's called BaconBacon. Just not exactly my cup of tea. Their coffee is really good, and the guy that served us was really nice.
author: Sarah G.

description: Really wanted to love this place, but honestly the food can easily be made at home for a fraction of the price. The tortilla for the burrito wasn't fresh, and the bacon in the breakfast sandwich was definitely reheated from previously being cooked. Staff are super nice and friendly and the place is very cute!
author: Kristin S.

description:
Delicious Breakfast Burrito 
Amazing Cuban Latte. 

Staff was extremely friendly and did a great job on a busy Saturday morning.
author: Cynthia P.

description:
This place is amazing. The breakfast sandwich is one of the best breakfast sandos I've ever had. The breakfast burrito is also scrumptious and not your average burrito- shredded pork with eggs, bacon, avocado + cheddar. 

The iced coffee is also great. They have crushed ice and almond milk.
author: Caroline L.

description:
This little restaurant has a theme that they passionately stick to. Bacon everything.  

:: The Almost Veggie Sandwich - One of the few menu items with vegetables. It was great how they packed everything in to this sandwich, and it somehow all stayed put. I asked for the scrambled eggs instead of over easy, so it wouldn't get all oozy and messy. Some people may prefer the liquid richness of the runny egg yolk though. 
:: Breakfast Sandwich - The brioche bun was SO FLUFFY! They've really perfected this baby. 
:: Porky Fries - The bacon bits were quite the salty bunch. They were almost like porchetta. A total splurge, but it was a fun one.

Great place to stop in for a quick bite or even a brunch when you don't feel like waiting in a long line.
author: Audrey L.

description: Food was amazing and reasonably priced. The man who greeted us and took our order was so nice and helpful. Would definitely recommend coming for breakfast!
author: Lauren C.

description: This little hole in the wall restaurant had good tasting food, good service but very little room to sit and wait to be served and the bathroom is tiny and dirty so if you are running in to get some tasty food to go its perfect!
author: Shellee P.

description:
I love bacon and am tired of restaurants being stingy with my favorite breakfast meat. My brother lives around the corner and on my last visit, eating at Bacon Bacon was at the top of my list. Unfortunately, I didn't get here until my last day otherwise I would have eaten here for breakfast and lunch every day. Finally--a restaurant that fulfills my bacon cravings!!

I got the breakfast sandwich as I was totally intrigued by the bacon jam. Not the best name for this saucy delight but I can't think of any other one that fits. The counter person said it was their signature sandwich and it totally lived up to its designation: Brioche bread, with a sunny-side up egg, bacon, more bacon, extra bacon, and bacon jam. So good, I got one to take on the plane for my husband back in NYC. 

Good strong coffee to wash it all down. 

Best last breakfast in SF. Will definitely be coming back next trip--first thing ;)
author: S P.

description:
Amazing. 

If you are a bacon lover this place has to be tried.

Bacon chocolate chip cookies.

Bacon breakfast tacos.

Bacon and pulled pork breakfast burritos.

Bacon scones.

You get the idea........... They serve breakfast all day and lunch is supposed to be pretty amazing. If you go early in the morning there isn't a wait, ever.
author: Denise B.

description: Such a great spot. I had a breakfast burrito that was to die for. My gf and I were getting a bit overwhelmed with the crowds at every spot, so we only went in because it wasn't crowded at all. As soon as we started eating it got packed. I'm glad we saw it when we did or else we would have missed out. Can wait to visit again.
author: Zhakiry R.

description:
All things wrapped, covered, and associated with bacon is heavenly.

Since my first father's day coincided with my son's sixth birthday my wife had the beautiful task of finding a breakfast spot that would satisfy both of our stomachs. Naturally, she pulls through and finds the bacon bacon cafe. Note my son and I tried this fine cuisine last year at Eat Real via it's food truck. To say the least it's one of our most favorite trucks.

Aeden enjoyed their breakfast sandwich while I got my favorite breakfast item, a breakfast burrito. At $7 it's reasonably priced and filled perfectly. No rice or potatoes which was fine by me. Satisfying, not overwhelming. In my college days this would have been disappointing, however, as a father being more mindful of my diet this was a worthwhile treat. 

On top of that I had an incredible iced Havana latte (mixed with condensed milk). It honestly is the best iced latte I've ever had. I even wondered for a second if some bacon was sprinkled for good luck ;)

The cherry on top or better yet the apple in the pig's mouth were our parting gifts. The young man staffed as the cashier that morning was a wonderful host. Warm smile and greetings for everyone. Anyway, I bothered him with plenty of questions/conversation during his shift and mentioned why we came to the cafe. As we were leaving he gave my son a piece of chocolate covered bacon for the road and for me a free sandwich card to use at their fisherman's wharf location.

It was a generous gift for my son and to include me was a bonus (Thank you again if you happen to read this review!). These are the kind of gestures that should not go unnoticed and encourages me to return to try the rest of their tasty menu.
author: Patrick Gabriel L.

description: This place was amazing!! My bf and I were in SF for the weekend and came across this small place. They had a very simple menu. I had the breakfast sandwich and my bf ordered the breakfast burrito. the sandwich was good but that breakfast burrito was soooo delicious. The coffee was your typical medium roast but it was ok. I think we will definitely pay a visit when we're in the area.
author: Karina A.

description:
Pros:

-Bacon fried chicken sandwich was awesome. Ordered it with the bacon mayo and bacon jam. 

-Chocolate covered bacon with heath pieces. My bf loved it. I thought it was subpar. It tasted like chocolate shell, or very cheap chocolate enrobing the bacon. Some like it though, just didn't do it for me. 

-Some very creative bacon menu items

Cons:

-Soon after opening, they ran out of root beer. I was there as off the grid had opened and had my eye on this place and it seems as though the planned poorly and came with a nearly empty keg of root beer. So that was disappointing.

-Staff was not friendly. The cashier was ok, the guy calling out our orders for pickup was, eh- a bummer. Spoiled the experience, because I was so happy to be there and patronize them. They just seemed bothered when interacting with patrons. Sad. 

Negative one star for the two cons.
author: Stardust N.

description: The food is awesome, and the service is even better. Got the breakfast burrito and couldn't have been happier. Pretty sure the guy behind the counter was the owner, and he was the man. Definitely coming back for lunch.
author: Dean H.

description:
Finally made it to the brick and mortar spot for Bacon Bacon and I could not be happier! Yes, there were many items that you cannot find on the truck, but I was on a mission to try the breakfast sandwich with a fried egg, cheese, yummy bacon, and bacon jam. It was sooooooooo good that I damn near finished it in under 3 minutes as the ooze of egg yolk ran down my hand. 

My next mission: banh mi sandwich.
author: Vanessa O.

description:
Bacon fried chicken sandwich is ridiculous..... Love it!!! Great mix of salty and savory. 

Got the Cuban as well. Decent, but not amazing. 

The homemade pork rinds were grub #100%
author: Jeffrey O.

description: The service there really sucks. The guy at the counter always looks grumpy and the paper bags they use are cheap and fall apart easy so your food falls through it. The food is good but service makes you want to run! Picking up food should not have to be an ordeal.
author: Miche P.

description: Pretty good breakfast burrito.  They have the Valentina hot sauce.  Not as good as Olive's though.  Solid dirty chai.  Might make your digestive system feel a little funny afterwards though.
author: Alison D.

description:
The bacon here is delicious!! I had the breakfast sandwich and the breakfast burrito. Both were good but I enjoyed the sandwich more. The sandwich was messy but the flavor of the egg and bacon stood out. The bun was toasted to perfection. 

We had the maple bacon scone, once again I was not disappointed. The bacon did not dominate and the overall flavor was mild and sweet. 

Great job Bacon Bacon!!!
author: James W.

description:
Three strikes...you're out. 
Ordered three things all failed--
Chicken sandwich: They make it with chicken thigh which is not good for biting into for a sandwich (too tough) and had a odd texture and flavor was lacking complexity of even a fast food chicken sandwich. 
The hamburger: was Very poor quality beef or at least was old meat. 
The bacon bouquet: most of the bacon was undercooked and had to pull away half of each piece because pure fat.
author: Danielle O.

description: The sandwich I ordered was great and the French fries were ok but the chicken salad my friend ordered had a bug crawling around in it
author: Jacquie W.

description:
After reading reviews, looking at photos, researching thoroughly, we made the trek to Cole Valley. This seemed like a bacon lover's dream come true, but now that I've been here , I don't need to return and here's why...

1. This place is tiny with very little seating. Read that as noisy, cramped and super annoying when you're sitting next to the mechanical horse thing with screeching children a foot away giggling gleefully ,so you feel like an asshole if you say anything. 
2. It took forever, ok the figurative forever, about 25 minutes, to get 3 sandwiches. That's an average of 8 minutes per sandwich! Understaffed? 
3. It ain't cheap. With all the extra money you're making, how about hiring more staff. See point #2. 
4. Most importantly, it's called Bacon Bacon you'd think they would use quality bacon. Come on!! Instead the bacon was thin, flavorless, barely there and tasted like the cheap Kirkland (aka Costco) brand. Sad face. If they had used Applewood smoked bacon, you'd be able to taste it. Instead everything tasted like pulled pork. if you add hot sauce, you'll definitely not taste bacon and you'll have to change the name of the sandwich cause now it's just misleading. 

The Cuban tasted like pulled pork with melted cheese and bland roasted red peppers. 
The breakfast burrito tasted like pulled pork with melted cheese and squishy baby food consistency avocado. It was so "wet" and greasy, the smell stuck to me for hours. 
The bacon chicken burger had the thinnest slice of really crunchy overly deep fried Panko crusted chicken breast known to man and by now you could probably guess...the bacon was not noticeable and bland bland bland. 

Echoing what another reviewer said, due to blandness, condiments have to be added. Bbq sauce would make more sense as something available to use. 

All these people who gave this place 5 stars are either friends of the proprietors, getting kick backs or living under a rock so anything would taste amazeballs. I was massively disappointed.
author: Betty V.

description:
I was super hungry at work so I decided to order from Bacon Bacon! I had one of their burritos and bacon cookies a couple years ago at Off the Grid and I thought the food was pretty good. This time, I tried ordering a "chocolate bacon" which is literally chocolate sauce on one slice of bacon; would I order it again? no. For the taste as well as the price ($3). I also ordered a breakfast bowl, and a side of fries just because. I usually check my bag before I walk off from picking up a delivery, but didn't this time. They forgot the fries, which I was specifically looking forward to at 10am, and when I called, the guy who answered pretty much shrugged me off. 
He said he could refund the cost of the fries and when I asked why he told me that Bacon Bacon doesn't have drivers and Grubhub could not send another one. He rushed me off of the phone and started taking someone elses' order without ending the conversation or confirming he got my information.

 I paid $23 not including tips for a slice of bacon and a soggy breakfast bowl, but luckily and deservedly I am getting a refund (after confirming with a second call). I will not eat Bacon Bacon! again. Customer Service 1/5. Taste 2/5 Quality 1.5/5
author: Kiwi B.

description: Best of all things bacon. We enjoy the food truck more often, but always love to get by the brick and mortar. It feels like a secret venue sometimes. No wait no lines just amazing bacon Ness.
author: Marc R.

description:
pro's:
good food
good for take out

con's:
parking sucks
not much seating
price is high for what you get
small portions
author: C J.

description:
Their breakfast tacos are so affordable and amazing. I used to grab a coffee here every morning on the way to work and the people that work here are always so friendly.
They have a great assortment of different foods and beverages and are totally down to change things up when they can. 
Having this place nearby is seriously the only thing I miss about that job.
author: Trouble B.

description: I hardly find any really good egg sandwiches that compare to my favorite breakfast joint in LA. This place is just as good! Really yummy food and friendly staff :) they took our pictures on the pig for their wall of photos haha
author: Darelle P.

description:
Wait, how have I not reviewed this place before? Since they moved into the neighborhood, we've had them in heavy rotation for weekend breakfasts/lunches. We also hit their food truck pretty frequently at Off the Grid in the Haight on Thursday, where their hamburgers frequently play the role of "only thing our toddler will eat at the food trucks."
I won't waste your time by noting that pretty much everything but the croissants has bacon in it, but I will note that my favorite items are the breakfast sandwich and the tuna sandwich. I've tried just about everything else on the menu at this point, and I have yet to have a bad item. I'm not a coffee drinker, but I also have it on good secondary authority that they make a mean latte.
author: Pat M.

description: The breakfast burrito is more like a carnitas burrito with bacon and egg. Not exactly what I expected, but still pretty damn good.
author: Huey N.

description: Giving 3-stars because I've tried other items on the menu I enjoyed.  But the breakfast bowl I had this morning is an embarrassment.  The eggs looked like they've been cooked in burnt butter or something.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: An impromptu trip past Bacon Bacon made for an excellent post-run in Golden Gate park. Out of the two items we ordered (Bacon breakfast sandwich and breakfast bowl) the sandwich was the winner. Perfectly fried egg where the yolk soaks into the bacon and roll. The avocado on the pulled pork bowl was a little disappointing but good mix of protein. While I didn't order coffee, I did see a few people only walk in for their java (drop and latte/cappuccino)
author: Kaitlin F.

description: With a name like 'Bacon Bacon' how can you go wrong? I tried the burrito and the breakfast sandwich and I was pretty amazed by both of those choices. The girlfriend and I went to two of their 'brick and mortar' locations and the food was exceptional at both places. This will most definitely be our spot for delicious and savory breakfast when we go back to visit San Francisco. In addition, I purchased a 24 ounce coffee and added a little bit of half-and-half. The coffee was worth it as well. Lastly, their pricing are very reasonable! If you are staying anywhere near Haight-Ashbury or you can get to the downtown location, it is well worth it.
author: Jay P.

description:
Small restaurant off of Haight x Ashbury serving up my favorite food: bacon. I had the burger and it was pretty good, I also got the bouquet and was slightly disappointed that they weren't rolled up pieces of bacon to look like roses (but at least they were perfectly crispy and delicious).

Seating is kind of hard, and the bathrooms are awkwardly upstairs and accessible through the kitchen, but this place is good if you live nearby or have an extraordinary craving for bacon.
author: Patricia C.

description: The food is great but you'll never get it.  They're drowning in Caviar and Postmates orders and don't prioritize orders actually in the store.  After waiting 30m for a breakfast burrito I had to get a refund and leave.
author: Sam S.

description: Discovered this place through an episode of chopped where the owner was competing and knew right away I needed to try it! Was not disappointed at all! My friend and I tried the grilled chicken sandwich, the cuban sandwich, and the Mexican hot chocolate - all were delicious!
author: Corinne K.

description:
Tried this place again for hot food. Disappointment again!!!!!!!!!
First of all- the cashier shook his tip jar pretty rudely to the woman in front of us. I found that extremely rude. She was so embarrassed that he did this in front of a very long line, that she walked back and gave him something.

Why else I'm mad?We ordered their parm/ herb fries. When we opened the box they were plain!!!! Nothing on them. Ughhhh. Barely any salt and definitely no cheese or herbs. 

My boyfriend loved their bacon burger. Im still pissed about the fries.
author: Erica D.

description: Awesome breakfast burritos. Good size, not too big but full of flavor! The pulled pork in there was really good. I would have liked more avocado but it didn't bother me much.
author: A C.

description:
Bacon bacon!! Love the name and they make a solid breakfast burrito (breakfast served all day) but sadly this place is just a-ok for me.

I got the Almost Veggie Sandwich but it was pretty oily and I felt it lacked flavor but the broccoli (an odd choice for a sandwich) made it all taste weird when I added the hot sauce. I ended up just picking out the broccoli first and then it tasted better. The egg was super runny which I love and I probably looked like a savage eating that sandwich but hey, I was hungry!

Next time will be back to try something else on their menu with some of their fries (porky fries anyone?!)!
author: Jingxi Z.

description: They never called my name and apparently someone took my food. Won't be coming back. #hangry
author: Christine C.

description: I LOVE the food here!!!  I wish there were more around town.  The Bacon Fried Chicken is the best fried chicken sandwich I've ever ever had.  The Melt is the best grilled cheese with bacon I ever had.  The bacon popcorn is beyond delicious and addicting!!!  And the staff is beyond friendly, it makes it like eating at home.
author: Shannon C.

description:
That is an EXCELLENT breakfast burrito. So simple, just some scrambled egg, BACON bien sur, pulled pork shoulder, avocado, cheddar. Perfect proportions so it's not like all egg filler or anything, and delicious every single bite. Throw on some hot sauce at the table.. DIVINE. Also a really good size -- had half in the AM and half at night. Tried their breakfast sandwich too, which was also awesome. This is dangerous, guys. May be a good Zazie substitute for fast brekkies.

$7, takes credit card. Opens at 7 am for the pre-work (or for me, post-night shift) crowd.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I had delicious iced coffee (crushed ice) and the most amazing breakfast burrito! The burrito of course featured great bacon, but also had amazing egg, cheesey cheese, fresh avocado, which
made for the perfect Sunday Funday starter!!

Would love to try the Bahn Mi and other treats.
author: Will O.

description:
Have only been to the cafe location, not the truck, but have had great experiences. They do an effective job of setting expectations in the name - you should know what you're getting into here. They creatively, or sometimes obviously, incorporate delicious, delicious bacon into everything on the menu. 

I first ordered the breakfast sandwich and the first couple bites (non bacon bites mind you, since the egg was spilling outside of the bun) felt like a standard breakfast sandwich. Then I hit the bacon, and it vaulted this hand held to probably top 5 breakfast bites in the city. 

 I've had the burger as well, and while also quite tasty, I might recommend venturing into more interesting territory when ordering. The cafe and service itself was excellent, and there's a giant pig you can take a pic in front of if that's you're thing.
author: Andres B.

description: Amazing find on our way out of SF! The entire family loved it. Highly recommend the breakfast burrito that is very different that would you would expect. The wife had the bacon grilled cheese. Coffee was so good that we had to get some more for the road back home. We will def be making this a regular visit on our next SF road trip.
author: Manny F.

description:
The truck came to SFSU and wasn't prepared to serve. A group of 5 people had waited for about 15-20 minutes for the truck to start taking orders. When one of the girls asked how long it'd be before they're ready, they said some amount of time and the group started walking away. The moment they stepped away, the truck started taking orders. They were pissed (I would've been too. That was messed up!) but I was glad I didn't have to wait for them to order either.
