I had the bacon fried chicken sandwich and the porky fries. The sandwich was ok but the fries were disappointing. The fries tasted like they were frozen at some point. They weren't crispy, nor were they soggy. They were in that weird in between when fries aren't fresh and so they had the texture of cardboard. Not worth it. Would I go back? Only if I had no other options.
author: Susana T.

description:
I wanted to love this place, I mean the name alone makes me happy. The bacon chicken sandwich got great reviews so I ordered it and was sadly disappointed. It was over fried to the point where it was near impossible to bite into and of course this also means it was incredibly dry. It was even a little burnt on the edges. 

Now, I will probably try this place again as anything can get messed up once. 

But my current three star review is because when something does go awry where the quality of the food is visually a mess I expect businesses to not serve it.  

So, overall I am bummed.
author: Karina B.

description: almost $20.00 for two just OK breakfast sandwiches? With mediocre bacon on them? Now in fairness, this bacon might be someone else's favorite bacon, but not mine. I like thin and crispy bacon. Bacon Bacon bacon is thick and soft. Coffee is all right. Very friendly and informative guy at the cash register who took our order. But the food did not justify that price, won't be heading back here anytime soon.
author: James P.

description:
Great little eating place. Went for a business meet up, just 2 of us. And it had perfect room to sit. Didn't get to crazy busy! Lots of food choices! Had the almost veggie and added avocado, YUM! Also had the chai iced tea, soy milk, also yum! 
I am looking forward to bringing my boyfriend, he works for Yelp and he LOVES bacon haha
author: Mary W.

description:
My boyfriend and I have been to their truck over a year ago and really enjoyed their grilled cheese sandwich. It's simple but delicious... I mean melted cheese, perfectly cooked thick cut bacon, bacon jam (can I buy a jar please?!) and nice toasty bread? I'm not sure how that can not be amazing!

So more recently I've been craving a fried chicken sandwich and felt it was the perfect opportunity to visit their actual cafe... If you walk from 16th and mission bart you will definitely feel like this was a very well deserved meal! Lots of uphill walking..

Anyways..

I got their fried chicken sandwich. To my disappointment it was a little dry.. Not bad though! It was still flavorful thanks to all the smokiness from the bacon. Although it wasn't burnt my chicken did come out black..which seems darker than other people's I've seen walking around with at off the grid and in pictures. That could be the reason for the dryness (but why would you serve it to me if that were the case?).

My boyfriend got their burger plus egg. This threw me by surprise. It was actually realllly good. It was juicy and flavorful..while he liked it he personally preferred my fried chicken sandwich to his burger.

I also got their bacon cookie to go which was good but nothing really special. Needed more bacon and chocolate chips.

The service is awesome and the cafe itself is hard not to love just by walking in... I mean you can ride a mechanical pig and there's bacon everywhere! 

Fun and yummy spot to eat at..definitely want to come back for some more bacon goodness (can I get a bacon caramel latte though?!)!
author: Melissa C.

description:
when you're called BACON, BACON, BACON what is NOT to love?!?!?

This place has all the delicious bacon menu items you dream of, just make sure you come early. My favorite menu item is the bacon bouquet, get one for your loved on TODAY!!
author: Amanda C.

description:
Bacon. Enough said. If you like bacon, you would like this place. 

Extremely friendly, courteous, accomadating staff.

Amazing!
author: Joe Y.

description:
Just OK. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back. 

Food: pretty good. I got the burger. They asked how I wanted it done and I said medium, it came out well done. It wasn't the worst but it too dry for me to really love it. D got the Cuban which he really enjoyed. We shared the porky fries which were good but missing salt. If you've been to Lardo in PDX, they're similar but not as tasty. 

Service: eh. The guy that took our order was great. He was friendly, efficient and pleasant. There was also a girl working the counter and her attitude made me so uncomfortable that I tried to avoid all interaction. When I asked for a side of mayo for my overdone burger, she looked at me like 'how dare you ask me for anything?!'. Yeah- NOPE.
author: Autumn Y.

description:
I should start this off by saying my boyfriend and his friends are all bacon fanatics. So with that in mind, we drove here one day for lunch because my boyfriend could not stop talking about this place! Parking was actually pretty easy to find. We just drove around the streets and found parking in the residential area nearby. 

Coming in here, I wasn't sure what to expect. I thought the place would actually be bigger and with chairs and tables and stuff, but no. There's just the window sitting which worked out for us just fine. The staff was definitely friendly and welcoming! They even replaced one strip of bacon that my boyfriend had dropped on the counter. :) 

I ordered their grilled cheese for $8 and let me just say, the first bite was HEAVENLY. Their bacon jam was somewhat sweet and it worked well with the cheesy goodness and salty bacon. It was like a party in my mouth as I took each bite. 

My boyfriend had ordered their bouquet of original bacon and he enjoyed that, but he had to order The Burger afterward to fill his hunger. No complaints, though. He was satisfied! 

And while I have not tried the coffee... 2 of my friends got it and said it was the best coffee ever. Definitely have to come back and try it! Along with their Mexican hot chocolate which includes little bacon bits!

Overall, this place deserves all the stars I give. There's no beating them!
author: Venus L.

description: Impressed! From the moment you walk in to order, the service is fantastic and the wait is actually surprisingly not long considering it's a Sunday. I ordered the famous breakfast sandwich and breakfast burrito which blew my mind! My husband loved the sandwich much more than when we had Eggslut in Las Vegas. We will most definitely be back very soon!
author: Jenna C.

description: Absolutely delicious! The breakfast burrito is amazing. Get it for sure. They have the perfect blend of cheese, bacon, veggies, and sauce. My mouth is watering...must go back.
author: Mio W.

description: There's few things in life as perfect as the Bacon Bacon Breakfast Burrito. The pulled pork is tender and juicy without being over seasoned. The avocado is creamy, the bacon crisp and meaty. Momma Lil's peppers pop with flavor (ask for a double shot, they're incredible). With egg and cheese all wrapped up in a tortilla. Just the right size too, big without being obnoxioous.  I like to add a little hot sauce, salt and pepper on the side to dip it in. Add a coffee (I do) and there you go, a great morning for $11 and change. Jim has a great operation and his staff are very friendly and welcoming every time I pop in.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Excellent place for a quick breakfast while I was on vacation. The breakfast sandwich was just the fuel I needed for a long day of sightseeing. I wish I could have tried everything on the menu, and my only disappointment is that I didn't get to stop by here for their lunch menu!
author: Monica M.

description:
Food is 4 stars but service for large orders gets 3.5 stars. 

Food is great and your belly will leave happy, but if you order from this place for larger lunch time orders (or in my case, for group lunch work meetings with 5+ people), there is a slight chance you'll experience a delay. When I ordered for a specific pick up time, I've experienced one 10-minute delay and another time, a 45-minute delay (granted we placed a fat huge order for 10 hungry people; I placed the order with a 90-minutes in advance).  

Best advice I can offer is to place the order many hours in advance. They get super backed up during the lunch hour so if you let them know far in advance, you'll have a better chance of getting your order on time. 

Parking around here straight up sucks by the way.
author: Ashley M.

description: The reason  I'm rating it 1 star is because I found a bug on my sandwich. It wasn't just a dead bug but an alive bug crawling from my bun to the avocado... IT'S ALIVE.... I'm glad that I always check my food because the only thing worse than finding a dead bug in your food is half a dead bug after you've taken a bite.....
author: Ke'Leiha P.

description: It was around lunch time and we were driving around San Francisco trying to figure out where to eat. A list of restaurants came up on our map, Bacon Bacon being one of them. Of course, the name immediately got our attention, so we had to come check it out. It did not disappoint. My son and I ordered the Breakfast Sandwich. My daughter ordered the Bacon, Swiss Croissant. My husband ordered the LGBT.  Three out of the four devoured our sandwiches. They were definitely outstanding. My son, who's a picky eater, was sad that his sandwich came with a fried egg instead of scrambled (my bad, I know he doesn't like fried egg, but wasn't thinking when I ordered). The super sweet and awesome guy working the counter noticed my son was unhappy and offered to make him another one with scrambled instead of fried. How awesome was that??!!!  My son had such a huge smile on his face!  Outstanding customer service!  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes breakfast foods and burgers.
author: Heidi M.

description: modern and minimalistic...red pig statue...a menu board over the order counter...airy cafe vibe...coffee and breakfast sandwich...coffee and breakfast burrito for other...burrito or sandwich are both $7 each...burrito is bigger, heavier, meatier and more filling deliciousness...bacon, pork, cheese, eggs and loaded with flavors...rolled tight and dense...the breakfast sandwich has perfect quality...fluffy brioche bun....perfect fried egg and of course thick cut bacon...cheese melting and holding together....just a great quality sandwich...good coffee to wash it down...excellent...don't expect a quick meal...nearly empty and it took some time to get our orders...
author: Hen A.

description:
They have a sign saying "Bacon Makes Everything Better," & this place indeed made that happen! Came here for Sunday brunch & was really impressed w/ the food

Porky Fries - these were just absolutely delicious! The fries were cooked & seasoned perfectly. The pork, yellow peppers & shredded cheese on top completed the fries altogether. Highly recommend! It is a big portion, but I was able to finish it b/c I have a huge appetite. I suggest sharing this between 2 people b/c it'll fill you up

BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich - absolutely amazing! Taking my first bite into this, I literally rolled my eyes & was in awe. The bread was soft; the pork was so tender & flavorful; the bacon was cooked jst right, not too crispy & not too soft; the bbq sauce wasn't too overwhelming but added some good extra flavor; and the slaw had a nice little crunch. Highly recommend trying as well! 

Overall, I thought the food was really great. Definitely check this place out! I will come back to try their other bacon goodies that they have on the menu
author: Trina N.

description: This is absolutely my favorite place for breakfast/lunch in the Haight and maybe the city. I generally crave Cuban sandwiches and Bacon Bacon knocks theirs out of the park. The breakfast sandwich and breakfast burrito are the best thing I've ever used to satisfy a dehydrated morning :) the coffees are excellent as well. The staff is very friendly and helpful and it is thankfully off the Haight Street path. Love. This. Place.
author: David C.

description:
Order the bacon fried chicken. 

And I'll quote myself here:

"The best use of my cheat meal calories in a long time."
author: Andrew C.

description:
What a sandwich! The BBQ pork on a brioche bun was outstanding. Enjoyed the tangy bbq sauce.

The Cuban on a ciabatta roll was good but a little on the salty side. I enjoyed the spicy heat, though.

Gonna try the bacon fried chicken sandwich next time. Don't think I can try the fries.  The sandwiches are generous in size. No dinner for me, tonight!

Very friendly staff.
author: Debbie T.

description:
On our visit to SF, I managed to go twice to Bacon Bacon in our four days there.  That is how good it is.  The Breakfast Burrito is killer - I ate a half at a time, so for like $8 a burrito was two meals! Score for me.

Very helpful staff, great coffee, and just an amazing taste.  Perfect mix of salty and savory and creamy and crunchy and wonderful.
author: Emily P.

description: Yum!   Delicious breakfast sandwiches!  Must try when in SF.  Short menu but what they do have is amazing!
author: Deb W.

description: Quaint little place in a neighborhood. So different. LOVED LOVED LOVED our food. Got the chicken fried bacon sandwich with regular fries. 100% A++++. Will definitely try the porky fries next time.
author: Sherri C.

description: The food is wonderful! Love the Bacon Bowl with the pulled pork. I think a little bbq sauce would put it over the top. We eat here whenever we're in town. You can't go wrong getting a meal from here.
author: Jason C.

description:
A chapter in my life has now closed...The search for the perfect breakfast burrito is over. 

Every bite of this burrito will reveal and new flavor. The texture is nothing but smooth and creamy with perfectly crisped tortilla and the Valentina sauce is a fantastic smoky edition to the symphony of flavors.

Thank you Bacon Bacon, you complete me.
author: erika s.

description: This place is very good. You have to be to call yourself Bacon Bacon. I had the fried chicken sandwich and fried mac and cheese. Little bit on the pricey side but it is very good so I guess you get what you pay for.
author: Matthew S.

description:
The only thing better than the food is the customer service. 
They've got their website dialed and make it super easy to order an individual meal all the way to catering parties. 
I placed an order for catering and Jim was in touch with me in just a a couple of hours and gave me his cell phone, which came in handy as I had a special request to make the night before my breakfast platters were to be baconed up and then scarfed down by my morning party guests. 
I'll be ordering again and so should you!
author: Ian M.

description:
Just got a speedy delivery from Bacon Bacon's cafe location via Caviar. YUM 28 minutes to breakfast bacony overload! Diet disclaimer: I try to eat low-carb normally but today I caved to the un-Caveman way. Time will tell if I am a fat bride next June or not...

The graded items du jour: 

A
Breakfast Burrito - $8.50 delivered / $7 in-house - A dense log of breakfast fatty delicious pork, bacon (you know it), scrambled eggs, cheddar cheese, guacamole, hot sauce and everything nice. Nicely toasted tortilla. Very satisfying, even if Richard Simmons watched you eat this, he'd cry. PETA too.

A-
Breakfast Sandwich - $8.50 delivered / $7 in-house - A close second to the burrito but if you want maximum overload and your full money's worth, grab a burrito. WARNING: the egg over easy yolk hiding under the bun WILL explode in warm yellow orange fireworks all over you and your surroundings when you bite into it. Eat with a plate underneath if you don't want an egg clean-up. I have egg globules in my hair right now and I am only sort of sorry about that.

B+
Muffin - $2.50 delivered / maybe $2 in-house - Luck of the draw revealed blueberry. A normal-sized muffin like your mom used to make, no 500+ calorie monster. Nice crumb, freshly baked, but could use more blueberries, imho.

Overall, I feel 5 pounds heavier now but content.
author: Sarah J.

description:
Bacon bacon bacon.  Who doesn't love bacon?

And who doesn't love bacon combined with boneless fried chicken breast and tangy slaw?  Cooked upon ordering.  It comes piping hot and very crusty and crispy.  Served on an brioche egg bun.  Chomp down with your first bite and watch the steam.   It's that hot.

Good fries too.  Sprinkled with shaved Parmesan and herbs. 

I also ordered a strip of dark chocolate covered bacon.   Thick bacon slice but not crispy as it's totally coated in chocolate.  You've got to be a real bacon lover at $3.00 a strip.

It's a small storefront.  Five seats at the counter facing the street, and four bar stool high tables that seat three comfortably.  

And an amusement bright red mechanical hog.   I think it works.  But we didn't try it.
author: Shirley N.

description: Bacon Bacon's burrito is pretty solid all around :) the sandwich is great too as is the coffee. Kill 2 birds with one stone: go check out the Grateful Dead house and then walk around the corner to get some delicious baaaaaacon!!!
author: Phil P.

description:
I am 90% sure that their breakfast burrito is the best one I've ever had. Holy F. 
 
I was just in town visiting and needed a spot for lunch... I yelped "burrito" and Bacon Bacon came up. And I am so pleased that it did. It's about two blocks from bustling haight street, so there aren't huge crowds or lines that you have to fight through to get here. Once you walk inside you are greeted by super friendly staff members who will efficiently take your order and leave you smiling. The food quickly comes out and then you may feast on your delicious meal. You will not regret making the decision to enter Bacon Bacon.
author: Jamie K.

description: If you enjoy bacon, this is the TO-GO PLACE to satisfy your bacon fetish. This cafe (more of a takeout) is tucked in the residential area and it was quite hidden! I was there in the morning, therefore the menu was quite limited. I had the pork belly bahn mi sandwich which was a good and well-executed. OMG, the bacon bouquet.... quality and seasoned thick bacon presented like a bouquet! I highly recommend sharing this with your dear friends or you may have a heart attack if you are to finish it alone.
author: Jackie M.

description:
I love having this place in my neighborhood. 

I mostly stop in for coffee or a latte, but have enjoyed a variety of their breakfast noms too. The scones are probably my favorite - they bake them fresh and they have a great texture. The breakfast burrito is also tasty if you like a LOT of meat. 

As good as the food and coffee bevs are, however, the people are probably the best thing about Bacon Bacon. The people who work there are great and other customers always seem to be enjoying themselves.
author: Jessica H.

description: Breakfast burrito is legit. Great portion of pulled pork, the peppers added a great touch. Top but it off with some hot sauce and we're in business.
author: Joey C.

description: YUM. I love bacon, and I love Bacon Bacon. We got food delivered from here to Finnegan's Wake while watching football hungover on a Sunday morning and it was basically like a miracle worker. I had the bacon cheeseburger and my fiance had a breakfast burrito. Both were so good, writing this review now makes me wish I could order it to my apartment on a Wednesday at 11pm.
author: Cynthia S.

description: Im lucky enough to have this spot right down the street, it is AMAZING. Favorite items are the breakfast sandwich and croissant with bacon jam. OJ is fresh squeezed and coffee is always tasty and strong. Not to mention the staff is always awesome. Do yourself a favor and get some bacon in your life asap!
author: Kelsey T.

description:
I give you a Haiku about the LGBT sandwich:

Was that Safeway bread? 
There was not enough bacon. 
I had such high hopes.
author: Russ S.

description:
Great coffee drinks 
Delicious breakfast - burrito, sandwich, taco - all delicious! 
They're relatively fast even if there is a long line. 
Even though there are few tables, people usually rotate pretty quickly. 

My one qualm is its a little bit expensive, but gotta say I prefer the establishment over the food truck.
author: Allie E.

description:
*This is for the ashbury heights location, not the truck 

BEST BREAKFAST BURRITO THAT I HAVE EVER HAD. Straight up. It is absolutely unreal. The breakfast sandwich is also really good but the burrito is just next level. 

Vanilla bean latte- unreal, esp cause I can opt for almond milk 
Fresh squeezed orange juice- actually unreal
They have Sriracha- unreal, because Sriracha is life 
overall, Bacon Bacon- unreal 

My only warning & complaint is that the food takes forever.. so call in your order ahead of time so you aren't waiting 20+ minutes for your dank burrito. ESP when you are starving and your hangover demands greasy yummy bacon enriched deliciousness in an immediate fashion.
author: Alex R.

description: If you want an awesome meal any time of day, go to Bacon Bacon. My wife and I went here twice while we were in San Francisco and everything we tried was delicious! The breakfast burrito was fairly small, but it was so full of flavor that I looked past the size.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Love coming here every time they send me to work out in the area! I always get the Bacon fried Chicken sandwich! It's a must try!
author: Antonio C.

description:
This place is hands-down amazing. There aren't many items on the menu but I think there's something for everyone! The coffee is really good, too.
I had the "almost veggie sandwich" (broccoli rabe, roasted bell peppers, provolone, fried eggs and bacon), it was delicious and very healthy! My roommate had a small breakfast taco and a maple bacon scone with bacon jam. You'd think that is enough bacon but we also got a bacon bouquet. You can never have enough bacon, and if you, too, believe that then you should go to this bacon-lovers paradise.
author: Dodi G.

description:
As not much of a meat eater, I can confidently say this is a great place to go on a weekend for a great sandwich. I got the grilled cheese which was awesome and filling for the entire day. The staff was very nice and the place was clean. Not a lot of seating but you can always go take it to a park nearby. 

Looking forward to the next visit!
author: Meaghan H.

description: Went back to bacon bacon. Moved away from SF and was excited to be back and get breakfast here.  Unfortunately the recipe has changed. It is now a totally average burrito.  I'm not unhappy with it, and if I lived down the street I'd visit, but I won't make it a point of visiting when I'm back in SF.  It used to be majority bacon and carnitas with egg as an addition.  Now it has two strips of bacon and more eggs.  This is fine...but just fine.
author: J R.

description:
Sweet baby Jesus, thank you for giving us pigs. 

I came to Bacon Bacon on a Sunday afternoon, having been jonesing for a good burger all week. After a quick search of the web and Yelp - Bacon Bacon seemed to be the best option in the area. Boy, I was not disappointed! 
The menu offered many options for breakfast that looked and smelled delicious on my fellow diners plates, but I had burger on the mind. The breakfast burrito with Chicharrónes I saw 1 table over will definitely be my pick next time though. 
The walkup ordering was super easy and the staff was more than helpful with questions about menu items. If you're looking for a soft drink, your options are limited, but let's be honest you're not coming to a place named Bacon Bacon for the sodie pop. If you're cool with aqua like me, there is a water cooler with cups in the back, so no need to buy a bottle. There are also a variety of teas and coffee beverages if you so choose.
I ordered the Bacon Bacon Double Cheeseburger with fries and it came to about $16. In a quick 8-10 minutes, it was ready. Seating is fairly limited so it was a perfect timeframe to wait for a table. Get a pic riding the pig while you wait!
The burger is prepared to complete perfection - two .5" patties ensconced in a sharp melty yellow cheddar and sauce sitting atop thick cut meaty greasy delicious bacon and sautéed onions all on a soft fluffy brioche roll (the perfect vehicle for all of that deliciousness). The bacon made me believe in bacon again. I didn't consider myself a fan of bacon before coming here, but I have since realized, I just wasn't a fan of the crappy thin, chewy, garbage that surely the pig making it would be ashamed of. Bacon Bacon's bacon is what bacon should be - thick and juicy. This was the best fast casual burger I've ever had - it blows Super Duper, Shake Shack, and Five Guys out of the water.
The fries, in my opinion, were fantastic. They were a basic, thicker cut (not steak fry), with shaved parmesan on top - no salt.

I will most certainly be returning to try other menu items. You get AMAZING food, a huge portion, and friendly service. What more do you need? Maybe a stroller, because when you leave you'll have twin food babies.
author: Patrick K.

description:
I really supported this business when they were going through the planning issues with the City - not because I like bacon (actually, I try to keep Kosher and am a recovering vegetarian) but because I support small businesses in my neighborhood. I really want this business to succeed, even though it's not ever going to be my cup of tea. 

My spouse has told me he's had Bacon Bacon's turkey burger and enjoyed it in the past. So it was disappointing when my spouse came home from here today, reporting that he'd ordered both a chicken burrito and french fries with NO cheese on either item. My spouse also said when his fries were delivered, they had cheese on them, so they had to make him a second order without cheese. As my spouse unrolled his burrito at home, he found - you guessed it - cheese on it. He called up, told them what had happened, and asked for another burrito without cheese, which he received.

You'd hope that when the server was told about the cheese on the fries, and was correcting that mistake, they would've stopped and thought for a moment about how to be sure the rest of my spouse's meal was up to par. But that didn't happen. 

Every business has its bad days, and maybe today was theirs. When there's so many good food offerings in our neighborhood, it is hard for me to imagine my spouse ordering from Bacon Bacon again any time soon.
author: Susan L.

description:
best easy breakfast spot in the neighborhood... Probably the only one actually. 

I just think its weird that they dont have crispy bacon. Isnt that the best part about bacon?

7 dollars for a corner store style BEC that is not as good as the corner store BEC thats 
$3.75 where I normally go. 

Service is okay. Efficient but not friendly
author: Peter M.

description:
THIS PLACE! UGH This place! (I mean this in the most loving voice ever)

I lived just a block away from Bacon Bacon so I was here every day for my morning coffee and when I was feeling fancy, a maple bacon scone. I became friends with all of the staff as they are all very wonderful.

List of my favorite items Bacon Bacon has to offer in no particular order:
Drip Coffee
Vietnamese Iced Coffee
Maple Bacon Scone
Parfait
Breakfast Sandwich
French Fries, both regular and Porky
Breakfast Burrito
Burger
Bahn Mi
The Cuban - No longer on the menu
Grilled Cheese

I do regret not being able to say goodbye as I suddenly moved to Orange County. I miss the people and I miss the food here. Next time I visit SF, I will definitely come by and say hi. I hope you guys don't miss us too much!
author: Bethany S.

description: This place is unique and lives up to its name. We got a bacon bacon breakfast burrito and let me just tell you.... it was divine! It had pulled pork,peppers, and lots of bacon! Also grab a stick of chocolate bacon which is absolutely delicious. When I travel to San Fran again Bacon Bacon is the place I will go!
author: Tyler R.

description: Great bacon-egg and cheese. It was really cooked to perfection, and the rolls were awesome. I had to go back before i left SF.
author: Brendan S.

description: Took my nephew for lunch, and it was great, my pie overcooked, but tasted amazing. My server suggested a swap, but the taste was perfect.
author: Alani R.

description:
Battle over the bacon?  Can't believe that one of my favorite SF eateries has temporary closed due to neighbors complaining of the smell of the discarded bacon grease.

Want to know an ancient Asian secret? I use my discarded bacon grease to make fried rice and it taste great!
author: Peter C.

description: If you love bacon, come here!! The breakfast sandwich was pretty tasty. In the fridge they had slices of chocolate covered bacon, I brought one home as a gift for my mom....holy sh*t it was so good. I was so upset I didn't bring home a bunch. But prob for the best. Was soooo good tho. Deff give it a try!
author: Jamie W.

description: Awesome spot. We each had the Breakfast Sandwich. The brioche bun, eggs, and bacon were perfect. Seriously it was amazing!!!  Wish we had a spot like this back in Denver.
author: J W.

description: Nothing special. I was expecting a lot more out of this place. The food isn't bad, and the bacon is really good. (I think it'd be even better if it was crispy though). The place is super small, so there's a pretty good chance you won't be able to dine in if it's around lunch time.
author: Elena P.

description:
I've been to the Bacon Bacon food trucks a few times and it has been consistently yummy! You can expect, of course, lots of bacon, and filling comfort foods. The sizes are a bit small for the price but the portions are definitely filling. 

I enjoyed the California Bacon BBQ Burrito, which was packed with pulled BBQ pork, bacon, french fries, and crispy belly. Though there is a LOT (and I do mean a lot) of meat, it doesn't taste too greasy, and at $9.50 (without tax), you are getting a lot of meat (although the burrito is considerably smaller than other ones of the same cost in the Mission district). The bacon grilled cheese sandwich is also very good: the Texas toast are treated immaculately with bacon jam (definitely beats the fruity stuff any day!) and the melted cheddar cheese with the bacon is perfect for a simple but delicious treat. I'm not sure that I would pay $8.50 for it though, but I was craving grilled cheese and tomato soup today, so this definitely hit the spot!
author: Vickie W.

description: We came, we ate and we BaConquered! Yup, not a word but I made it up... If you love bacon, do yourself a favor and stop into this awesome spot. We had the grilled cheese, the bacon fried chicken sandwich and porky fries... Delicious! We left in a BaComa, another new word. I love bacon bacon!
author: Kristy W.

description: GO early on a Sunday to beat the crowd. If you have to wait in line, don't worry - it's worth it.
author: Justin B.

description:
Updated Review!

Bacon Bacon has won me over again. In the past two months I've had only good experiences. Ingredients and dishes haven't been out of stock, service has been friendly and quick - and most importantly of all - their grill is working and they're on their full menu again! If you're looking for heart-stopping and delicious greasy breakfast I haven't found any better than their full menu, and I still drop in for drip coffee at least twice a week. Bacon Bacon is back, and my heart is rekindled!



Old Review **

TLDNR: Tasty, pricey, cafeteria, friendly, slow, broken stove they won't fix, inferior menu as a result, terrible americano, often out of ingredients 

I want to love the Bacon Bacon cafe, I really do. I'm loving on momentum long after the fire is out. Bacon Bacon, you've changed and so have I. 

When we first met, it was like it was meant to be. If just moved to the neighbourhood and you had cheap coffee. I fell for you gooey sandwiches, cheap drip coffee and friendly staff, and overlooked your faults like broken wifi, lack of hustle and second rate atmosphere. You charmed me with your $0.10 mechanical pig and cute logo colour scheme, so I dealt with the facts you overcharge for a cafeteria and you're always out of something without posting it. 

They say love helps you pull through the hard times, so when your griddle broke and you had to make a whole new menu of largely inferior foodstuffs we stuck with you. We say you trying and we tried back, supporting you. 

I don't know when I started to realise the fire was gone. Maybe the third time I sat around long after I order had been forgotten. Maybe it was when I finally said "never again" to the most awful American in town (despite good drip). Maybe it was the second time I waited in line to find out when ordering that you were put of bacon... In a place called Bacon Bacon. 

No, it was when I learned you never plan to fix your grill and get your menu back. I know it's expensive, but you broke my heart. I'll still visit, and I still love things about you (like the reuben), but the love affair is over. Look me up if you ever change your mind. *sniff*
author: Avery A.

description:
Great little food place that's like a bacon-inspired take on taquerias. We both had the breakfast wrap, which very very tasty. We also had a bacon bacon Elvis bar, a peanut-buttery bacon-studded sweet. And the coffee was quite good. 

Overall, a neighborhood gem, but it only has 3 tables and a small counter for dining in.
author: Scott L.

description: EXCELLENT SERVICE! Recommend the double double bacon. So good! Chocolate bacon, basically hot chocolate and bacon with chocolate pieces. Prices are perfect. No complaints. Clean place. Bacon is well made. Its not like the bacon you get in the stores, its filling. Friendly service. A++
author: Cristian A.

description: Got the breakfast burrito here. The burrito was mediocre. Comes with a small sliver of avocado and soggy eggs. We ended up waiting 30 minutes to get our food.
author: Matthew F.

description:
Awesome food!
Tried the pork belly and cuban sandwiches, both were great.
A tiny but cute place.
author: Peter O.

description:
Never underestimate the force of the bacon side. 
Bacon this, Bacon there, Bacon today and tmw!
Had a bacon chocolate chip cookie, bacon fused breakfast sandwich and bacon coffee. No wait, I just had coffee. Oooof, bacon everywhere. 

NOM!
author: Pepe W.

description:
had porky fries from their food truck. no bacon in it even though the description said differently. the sprinkled "herbs" (I'm guessing) looks fuzzy, not sure if that's suppose to be like that.

and then I had a mild food poisoning right after finishing. 
:(
author: YY M.

description: The breakfast burrito is AMAZING. Make sure you try some of the hot sauce on it!
author: TJ L.

description: Had a very good breakfast burrito at Bacon Bacon last weekend.  The best part was... you guessed it... the bacon.  Before moving to San Francisco, I only knew about the basic ways to cook bacon.  Thick-cut, or not... and crispy... or not.  I've tried the Millionaire's bacon at Sweet Maple and its all well and good, but it doesn't compare (in my opinion) to the simple, yet delicious, all-american, you-don't-have-to-be-a-foodie-to-appreciate it, bacon.  The only reason I don't give Bacon Bacon five stars isn't because anything was wrong, but just that other than the bacon, everything else was 4/5 star-worthy.  Will be back.
author: Joe L.

description: bacon    The breakfast burrito was so amazing!  Avocado, pork, bacon, pepper, eggs.  Great flavor!
author: BB S.

description: Small place but once you try the food you won't care. The staff was super nice as well. I would go back especially for the grilled cheese!
author: Mary C.

description: Unbelievably delicious breakfast burrito pork shoulder was so tender only thing I could say would be a nice side of yogurt or sour cream to dip it in would be awesome where are the ability to add some veggies.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
So many times SF has let me down.  The restaurants seem to be getting more snooty by the minute.  And the self important Tech upperclass is bringing the diversity of the city down day by day.  So i was skeptical walking into Bacon Bacon.  I didn't want to try their truck because their restaurant has more stars.  I couldn't have been more pleased with my decision.

I got the breakfast burrito because it was recommended on yelp.  It was delicious.  I wasn't the only one that thought the place tasted pretty good.  I had a classmate with me and he thought the same.  I also tried the bacon hot chocolate.  It reminded me of a mexican hot chocolate.  I could feel the tiny fat globules in every sip adding that savory flavor.

I would highly recommend Bacon Bacon.  Come for the laid back atmosphere and the tasty food.  I also highly recommend the breakfast burrito.
author: John P.

description: Amazing food! Came here for a Sunday brunch and was very impressed with the food quality and taste. The restaurant is pretty small but luckily my gf and I were able to find seats quickly. I ordered the porky fries and the daily special which was a cuban sandwich and boy were both great. Porky fries were covered in pork and cheese, very good amount of fries as well. The cuban sandwich was really good, great cuts of meat and the bread was freshly made and soft. Overall really happy with my experience here, would highly recommend it!
author: Josue V.

description: The food was pretty good, but not worth the long wait in cramped quarters.  It was a very cute place and the staff was very nice, but feel did not have a place to sit there which I didn't realize when we went.  I ordered the fried chicken sandwich which I enjoyed, but it wasn't particularly memorable.
author: Sandy F.

description: Ordered (via Postmates) The California Bacon BBQ Burrito and The Cuban - both were very good! I was skeptical about The Chocolate Covered Bacon, but it was delicious!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Good god, this food is incredible.

I live right across the street from this fine, fine institution. If I wasn't able to restrain myself I would probably be there every single day, resulting in heart disease or coronary artery issues.

The breakfast sandwiches are among the best I've had. Perfect egg, bacon, cheese, bacon jam... Mmmmmmm! But the real treat, in my opinion, is the bacon fried chicken sandwich. It is truly god inspired. It was a gift from Jesus, Moses and Allah--they all got together a couple of years ago and collaborated on their finest creation. This sandwich is LIVING PROOF that not only does god exist, but he wants us to enjoy delicious bacon (even Allah).

There you have it. Read no further, because the rest of these reviews are irrelevant now that you know this place is top-tier.
author: Evan M.

description:
The burger was quite small to cost 9$. The ingredients tasted good, meat was cooked perfectly, the bread was not sweet, no crazy ingredients or sauces added.

Chicken sandwich was alright.

With that name one would expect some amazing bacon, it was average, nothing to phone home about.

Bottom line: decent food, a little over priced.
author: Xavier R.

description: Get the bacon grilled cheese! It's so good! Don't do it with a sweet drink because that's just too much for your stomach. My friend tried the breakfast sandwich with hot chocolate and it didn't do her stomach well. Which is why I ordered a lemonade.
author: Moriah P.

description:
So, yeah, I am jumping on the bacon band wagon. Er, food truck.

Who HASN'T heard of Bacon Bacon? Who ISN'T sick of the bacon on everything except, well, what the hell why NOT in your coffee too craze? And lastly, who WOULD turn down bacon in any form, I mean for real - say it's just sitting there, in your kitchen or at your desk. You wouldn't nibble? You would have a bite? You would "accidentally" devour it all? Ok. I guess it's Lie to Us All Day. My Bad.

You would and we all would and even Vegetarians would THINK about it.

THAT'S why Bacon Bacon exists and that is ALSO why they thrive.

Bacon Fried Chicken Sandwich. Is it a mistake that I always erroneously type "friend" instead of "fried" 9 times out of 10? No. It's psychology at it's finest and fried IS my friend and SO is BACON!!

This seems like when you look at it you will get short of breath, when you bite into it your heart will skip a beat and when you stuff that last bit in way to quickly after receipt when you were definitely not going to eat it aaaalll, you will feel guilt but you will also feel like a badass. Because you survived it, you were a pig on it and you loved it and you know it.

Do it.
author: Katie W.

description: I regret ordering the Cobb Salad...should have gone for that breakfast burrito everyone raves about. My husband enjoyed his double cheese burger. The fries were perfect. My son liked the grilled cheese with Bacon. Order your to go. Restrooms are behind the counter through the double doors upstairs to the left. I'll be back to order something better. Efficient service. Clean. Worth a shot as well as a return...oh grab the lemonade.
author: ann s.

description: Great place if you love bacon! Plus they make an excellent cafe latte! Not healthy though. Lol
author: Lance P.

description: We had to stop here before we headed back to Long Beach... We ordered the Bacon Bouquet, Bacon Grilled Cheese Sandwich and Chocolate Covered Bacons... I wanted to love the chocolate covered bacons but I just wish the bacon could stay on a crispy side somehow... We were happy to have tried:-) We LOVED the bacon bouquet the grilled cheese though! The bacon jam inside the sandwich was so yummy!! We will definitely be back! Oh and it's located in a quiet neighborhood away from all the noises which we loved, we took our food to go and walked up to the Vista Park to enjoy yummy food and a great view:-)
author: Anna K.

description:
It's hard to say no to bacon. Especially when it's yummy bacon. 3.5 stars for a yummy lunch/brunch place.

We had the bird and the hot italian- both flavorful sandwiches. We were a bit disappointed that the bacon in the bird was a bit dry and cardboard-y. They do have awesome bacon chocolate chip cookies though (with full sweet bacon goodness)
author: Amy D.

description: The good is always good, the service always nice. Their fries are delicious but I have yet to try their porky fries because I haven't come here with anyone to split them with. Very small site but a nice vibe, always have music playing in the background. The menu stays relatively the same, with a few changes & specials often. The sandwiches are packed full of meat or whatever is on the sandwich. You get your money's worth. Their chai tea lattes are delicious and you must try their Mexican hot chocolate (with chocolate covered bacon & mini marshmallows on top). It's rich but you have to try it once!
author: Hitomi S.

description: Hang over food heaven! Breakfast burrito, amazing. Breakfast tacos, so good. Bacon always wins.
author: Lindsey A.

description: Stopped in for lunch on Tues afternoon. Service was good and the food was delivered to our table wthout much waiting time. I had the bacon bacon double cheeseburger and a side of chicharrones. After all the great reviews I was hoping for an amazing burger. I was rather disappointed. The patties were overcooked, and the burger was just overall dry and bland. The burger was so dry I actually had to resort to putting ketchup and mustard on it. The bacon on the burger was the only good thing the burger had to offer. The chicharrones were very good. I'm not sure if I would go back or not, maybe.
author: Jason T.

description: Soooo good. I had a latte and a bacon & swiss croissant. Delicious!! Good service, relaxed little cafe, and outstanding food with bacon in it. What more do I need to say?!
author: Ashley J.

description: Ordered the breakfast burrito to go. Oh man is this good! it's pulled pork, eggs, cheddar cheese, guacamole, a green pepper, and BACON! I'm used to disappointing breakfast burritos with more eggs and tortilla than anything else but this burrito was all pulled pork and bacon delight! and the egg was there to compliment the meat. DUDE this is the real deal ! Add in cheddar is one of my top choices of cheese and it's been a great Sunday morning already. Ordered picked up avoid the lines. Took 5 minutes. Thanks bacon bacon. A+
author: Christian C.

description: I love bacon period. Highly recommend this nice lowkey spot for all BACON LOVERS! Gotta get yourself a 'Bacon Bouquet' or a 'Mexican Hot Chocolate'... So much to choose from, i'm sure anything you get will satisfy yours  GET HERE!!!
author: Chris D.

description: Good pork tacos and well done fries, what more could you ask for!
author: Colin B.

description:
No longer just a mobile food truck, you can now go to Bacon Bacon's brick & mortar location in Cole Valley for breakfast Monday through Saturday. It has the look of a temporary location since the signs and menus are hand-written. It's also where they prep items for their food truck. For breakfast they had breakfast sandwiches, parfaits, pastries, and coffee. They also sell Bacon Bacon t-shirts, caps, chocolate dipped bacon and bacon popcorn. 

There isn't any seating but they have counters where you can stand and eat. The framed vintage bacon advertisements are a cute bacony touch. 

* Scone ($3) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/AMhmArFJ0IAeknI1mDE6ew?userid=NOUfyJW-BAo_-Cbfo8edww#AIvMuPCHkRe7M-6FMK7b9Q: A warm, triangular large scone, sweet and tender with tiny bits of bacon inside, it was sweeter than I expected. I liked the crusty saltiness of the cheddar cheese they added on top. The scone was excellent on its own. The thick bacon jam they put on top was cloyingly sweet (sweetened with honey) with lots of tiny hard pieces of bacon and caramelized onions. I think I'd prefer bacon butter or some other saltier bacon condiment. 
* Coffee ($2): Honduran, good and strong, just right for bacon treats
author: Lolia S.

description: My friends and I needed some morning fixings after waking up in the afternoon during our stay in San Fran, and we decided to walk over to Bacon Bacon for some bacon (duh). This place makes a mean breakfast sandwich, and breakfast burrito. The meal ended up putting us in a food coma. It's just a vicious cycle you just can't get away from.
author: Melanie T.

description: the food is absolutely amazing. been slowing trying everything on the menu and so far it all rocks. the place is small and cute and cute guys work there.
author: Salah Kal-El B.

description: I love bacon which is what drew me here but their breakfast menu just didn't cut it for me the first time around. I had the breakfast bowl and the almost-vegetarian sandwich and both just lacked the overpowering bacon taste I desired. Maybe it was just my first experience and maybe lunch is better but combined with their prices for the small portions I will probably try out other spots before returning.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Bacon Bacon or Barkin' Barkin'?  Management Does Not Care.

Another day with more Bacon Bacon patrons tying their dogs to the tree in front of the cafe -- followed by endless barking, crying, yipping, whining and growling of the dogs whose owners ignore them.  

It is clear it is disturbing the peace of the neighborhood -- even clearer that the in-store patrons are no happier.  Yet Bacon Bacon won't respond to calls and pleas to management to address this persistent nuisance (and by persistent, I mean repeatedly every day).

Responses by Bacon Bacon managers/employees include the following: "It's not our problem -- we don't own the tree and the dogs aren't ours,"  "You have to talk to the owner [do they mean of the store or the dog?]," "Too busy to address this [click]," "I can't do anything about it." 

Many small business are respectful to their neighbors and post signs about respecting the neighborhood.  Not Bacon Bacon.

As for the dog owners: leaving your pet outside barking and crying over a period of time is not quality time with your animal -- and clearly your animal is not happy.  Put your order in, wait outside with your dog then go to a park where you both will be happy.  Please don't be the d'bag who puts other people in a position to have to confirm for you what you already know: your dog is annoying.

Since direct pleas to address the Park and Bark issues are not addressed, let's see if social media captures Bacon Bacon's attention.   Bacon Bacon, please tell your patrons who leave their dogs outside your store making noises that this causes a disturbance and is disrespectful to those who live in the neighborhood and cannot escape it.  Thank you.
author: Kate M.

description:
Stopped by for breakfast and it was a really good find.  As the name would suggest bacon is on everything but they do it well.

I opted for a light breakfast of a cheese and bacon scone and split a bouquet of bacon(6strips of bacon) with everyone else.  It didn't disappoint, the bacon was the high point and they are doing it well there.

My dad had the breakfast sandwich which was huge and covered with cheese, egg and of course more bacon.

I would definitely go back if in the area.
author: Kev R.

description: I'm from NY and their "New Yorker bacon egg and cheese" is hands down the best I've ever had.  It's safe to say I've had 1-7 B.E.C.'s per week for 29 years of my life.
author: Hailey T.

description:
Yes, everything is bacon themed.

- Pork belly: on the same bun as the burger. The pork belly is well seasoned and rich, and it comes with arugula and an egg. You can't really go wrong with this combination.  The bun holds the meat well and I like that they just don't use a brioche because a more buttery bread would make it too heavy 
- Fries: with herbs and Parmesan... Yes, we added an egg to this, too...
- Burger: with bacon, sautéed onions, cheddar, and we added an egg (of course...). The patty itself was moist and well seasoned. I could have done without the house sauce since I don't like aiolis

Condiment wise, they do have ketchup, and I really liked the house mustard.

Even though everything has bacon or pork of some form, they don't overdo it, so it's all pretty well balanced.  My one tip: what's better than bacon on everything?  Bacon AND a fried egg with a runny yolk on everything.
author: Marilyn H.

description: Oh goodness. I thought I couldn't possibly love bacon more than I already did. I was wrong. The burger (a double cheeseburger with  needless to say, bacon) was perfect, and the porky fries (fries, peppers, bacon, pork shoulder) were astonishingly good and filling. Only slight negative remark, no fountain drinks or refills. But really, this is a delicious place to have lunch or brunch.
author: Stefano Z.

description: The food and service was good but I'm a big bacon fan so I expected great bacon and didn't get that. Honestly was disappointed because I couldn't taste the bacon in the cali BBQ bacon burrito I got. I got also got the fried mac and cheese bacon balls and barley taste bacon but they were pretty dam good. The chocolate covered bacon was also good but not that great.
author: Angel V.

description:
This is place is the bomb. The bacon bomb. They know their bacon and they do it right every time. I generally get the breakfast sandwich, but the scone is a winner too.

My most fun experience was actually with the Bacon Bacon food truck. They hosted a 3 course dinner for two special in their truck. My girlfriend and I went and it was awesome! We got to sit in the front of the truck and were brought course after course of delicious bacon treats for the next 1.5 hours. Yes, my arteries are now clogged.
author: Milan T.

description:
I honestly can't tell wether these guys don't understand "vegetarian" or if they're just trying to piss people off to stay cool.  
TL;DR: Don't ask for substitutions, they're not really okay with it and won't actually do it - but they're not willing to tell you that to your face either. 

When I walked in with a bacon loving boyfriend, I was hopeful that I too could have a warm kitchen item like his breakfast sandwich, and asked if the almost veggie sandwich could be made vegetarian. The guy behind the counter said yes, so that's what I ordered. But it's not what I got.  
To be perfectly clear, It would have been just fine if he'd said "no, we don't do substitutions" or "no, we won't do that". I'd have gotten coffee and a pastry and no harm done.  
Instead, I got a standard bacon sandwich. The server returned to the counter, had someone from the kitchen pull the bacon off, and brought it back. So I got a really greasy looking sandwich that had been piled in bacon a minute ago, which is gross and definitely not vegetarian.
I wouldn't have minded waiting for them to make a sandwich that wasn't covered in bacon grease. But at this point, I didn't trust them to do that, so we just left when the boyfriend finished his sandwich. We wasted $10 on a sandwich I didn't eat.
author: Brigitte B.

description: Very clean, advertised on yelp as breakfast...I'd suggest more lunch focused. Ordered the breakfast burrito & parm fries. Both delicious. Very pleasant staff and nice simple neighborhood gem. Relaxed. .take& go recommendation.
author: Sharine d.

description: This place is amazing! I go practically every weekend to satisfy my breakfast burrito craving. The employees are very friendly, the location is great, and the food is superb. They have so many great options and a full coffee bar. I don't have a negative thing to say, except that I do not think the quality of their food from the food trucks is as high. They also offer a punch card so I am rewarded for all of my purchases.
author: Kristin C.

description:
Good but don't think I'll have a craving to come back. 

Definitely bacon crazy menu. So I was pretty excited since I love me my bacon. 

Had the bacon fries. Good. Had a little hint of rosemary I believe. I really liked the blueberry lemon soda. My cousin ordered a sandwich. She liked it but I preferred mine more. I ordered something very banh mi inspired.
author: Glessie C.

description:
I have only tried the Breakfast sandwich from here and it is so yummy! Love the sweet/salty combo of the shredded pork with the bacon. The egg is cooked perfectly where it is still a runny goodness. Everything together with melted cheese on a soft brioche bun makes the breakfast sandwich perfect. I also tried a sample of their bacon scone and it was also delicious. What can go wrong with bacon? 
If its your first time going to the cafe location, the store can be hard to find since it doesn't have any clear sign.
author: Arda S.

description: I eat here every weekend because it's that good. The breakfast burrito is always the move. Don't be fooled by the food trucks, this is the real deal. Bacon, avocado, egg, pulled pork, pepperoncini, cheese. This will save you from any hangover and fill you until dinner for 8 bucks and some shitty change.
author: Mark M.

description:
I am in love with this place!!!!

Coffee is great; smokey with an almost chocolatey rich flavor. One of the only coffees I've had that I can drink without any kind of sweetener in it. 

Their maple bacon scones are probably the best breakfast pastry I've ever had. They are nice and dry, as a good scone should be, with just a hint of sweet icing. They top it off with little pieces of candied bacon... It's heaven. Perfect with coffee. There was a time were my fiancé and I literally had them for breakfast 5 times in one week. It was becoming a problem lol. 

All of their sandwiches are great, the bread they use is so fresh and delicious and soft. The LGBT (their version of BLT) is my fave. 

As far as the actual bacon they use in their dishes, it's cooked just the way I like it. Crispy, but not TOO crispy; you can still feel the chewiness of the fat and meat content. 

Only problem I have is that it's expensive for what it is.... But people pay a lot of money for their addictions, so I guess they are just being smart about it.
author: Jessica K.

description: I love how the food truck now has an actual sit down location to eat yummy bacon. My kids love how you could ride a pig even!
author: Cynthia L.

description:
I come here every time trying something new. This time, I got a Cuban sandwich off their new menu. 

Unfortunately, it wasn't anything special. The bread was kind of dry so that ruined the sandwich for me. The turkey in it was okay and the bacon was just okay. I guess I'll just stick to the breakfast burrito from now on.
author: Cathy N.

description: Omg! This place is amazing. We stopped by here while visiting San Francisco for breakfast/lunch time. The menu has so many choices! I went with almost veggie sandwich and my boyfriend got a Cuban sandwich. The staff at the place were very nice. Highly recommend for all bacon lovers!:))
author: Nadia R.

description:
Breakfast sandwich was great! It had thick slices of bacon that was the perfect brunch sandwich for me.  My friends had the breakfast wrap, and felt that it was a bit heavy but still good! 

Pig ride didn't work--waste of a dime.
author: Em L.

description: One word...delicious!!! Everything had bacon in it, I had the breakfast sandwich with bacon, fried egg and cheese no picture to post as I couldn't wait to dig in...it was amazing.  The cashiers were also so nice service was fast.
author: Katherine B.

description: Our all time favorite food truck! We even hired them for our wedding. The food has never left us wanting anything more! I recommend the bacon fried chicken- my mouth is watering
author: Lyndie W.

description:
I took a chance coming here and was not disappointed.  Nice neighborhood and parking was easy for me to find.

Shop is small, but inviting with some modern amenities.  I tried the breakfast sandwich and was impressed.  The bacon of course was delicious and I loved the bread they used for the sandwich.  Would definitely go again!
author: Ricky S.

description: This is for the truck in pleasant hill. I have never had bacon with so little flavor that it did not even taste like bacon. Had the chicken fried bacon sandwich and it was not that great. The chicken was dry and the bacon didn't even taste like bacon. I am wondering if they left off an ingredient because there is no way anyone with any cooking skills would think that tasted good. I am picky but my husband who is not even said it had no flavor. Over priced and under spiced. Skip it!
author: Jamie S.

description: Awesome breakfast spot. The service is quick and the combinations are so good...I mean...it's bacon. YES.
author: Ashley M.

description: Had the bacon ruban. It was porklicious! Service was quick wasn't crowded and the place is nice and clean. Prices arnt to outragous.
author: Michael H.

description:
East Coasters will love and appreciate Bacon Bacon, for their signature bacon, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwiches! This is something that is near impossible to find, in California (done right) - a nice-sized roll, with plenty of delicious, thick-cut, perfectly-cooked bacon, a nicely fried egg, and topped with plenty of melty cheese. 

The ingredients were high quality, and everything was perfectly cooked, and well-presented. 

Be careful, though: that fried egg comes sunny-side up, which means that in addition to being delicious, it's also quite messy! Since I almost always order my eggs scrambled, I completely forgot that fried eggs usually come with soft yolks, and this immediately led to me squeezing yolk all over my shirt! 

But, even though I almost exclusively prefer hard-cooked yolks, I was pleasantly surprised to find out how delicious it was, on this sandwich.

The bottom line: fear not the Yolk--at Bacon Bacon, the Yolk is Bacon's friend. But keep your napkin at the ready!
author: Steven P.

description:
I had the breakfast burrito - it was OK, nothing spectacular. There was not that much bacon in it. For a place called Bacon Bacon, there should be ALOT of bacon, but this is not the case here.

The bacon fries was another case of lacking in bacon. It was more like Carnitas with some bacon bits. We asked for well done fries which they followed and the fries came out very nicely and tasted great.

Another low mark is their system - they will take orders from a long line of customers, cook a lot of burritos, prepare all the sandwiches ordered then release them in no particular order. You got your food randomly. We ended up being served last in a batch of about 10 people and we were there first!

Not worth going back.
author: Rico R.

description: I have driven from the Sac area to eat at Bacon Bacon! Never a disappointment.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Bacon Bacon... where to begin? Let me start off by saying I am a huge fan of bacon and all things carnivore. When I realized there was a cafe in my neighborhood where almost every option on the menu contains bacon, I freaked with excitement. Not to mention, I often catch the 6 in the morning right outside, so it's a fantastic spot to grab a cup of coffee to sip with my commute.

That being said... this morning I ordered a breakfast burrito for the first time, and I must say I feel way more hungover than when I woke up this morning. The hell? Their burrito is 95% greasy pulled pork with a small smear of avocado and a tiny portion of eggs and bacon. In fact, it was so greasy that I saturated three napkins with fluorescent orange and had to go back for more. By the time I was half done, the bottom of the second half was literally soggy with the amount of grease that had pooled in the bottom of my to-go container. Yuck!

Last week I tried the cheddar bacon scone, and it was tasty, but I'm pretty sure they sold me a day-old for full price - it was quite stale. 

I want to love you Bacon Bacon, I truly do: both the owner (I think she's the owner? A ginger I see there time to time who LOVES to chat) and all of the employees have phenomenally friendly customer service. I also love the pics of neighborhood kids on the stop's old school horse-riding toy. The coffee is cheap and super convenient - I'll always keep coming back for that. But step it up with the food! Maybe next time I'll try the frittata and see what happens.
author: Simone B.

description:
Great, fresh, wholesome food. Good ingredients to go along with their amazing bacon sandwiches. My only.complaint is the coffee. The coffee is just plain atrocious! But otherwise, a fantastic eatery overall.

Owners!: For the sake of your establishment, look into other coffee.
author: Michael K.

description:
As it is seriously one of my deepest wish in life to Always have a Bacon Bacon as my neighbor no matter where I live and I worry sometimes because they're not ever crowded when I go, and they close early at 3p most days... Why?? Has the neighborhood with all the gatzillion companies and businesses and residential bldgs. And ballpark nearby- Still not discover you?? Maybe it's your very subdued subtle signage, I would miss you too if I was not a bacon bacon foodtruck planned to stalk bersearcher... I had just heard about ur food truck on 11th and had a scheduled attack plan but then found out, whuuth? New Bacon Bacon cafe opened 2blocks away??!! Only then did I really believe in destiny and karmic fate... or that maybe I really am one of the luckiest people alive as some have said. (Tho still not a full believer, definitely there r luckier peep esp. in sf.. but digressin..I'm ok lucky, grateful no matter, Love Life!) in any case, the Bacon is here and he is mine! 

The only taint on the pork train is that I can't go there everyday as its a bit on the spends side for me. Though you have some well priced items I find it impossible not to have the Cuban every time, altho well worth the $10+ sandwych$ but then the porky fries are necessary to the essential Cuban (u will understand why)then the bacon desserts, sometimes caramel, sometimes chocolate, a bacon flavor chain that u just let happen since u didn't wish to interrupt it anyway...

I think there are other items on the menu, I've split halves of other sandwiches when I can spare/share the Cuban. Love the bacon fried chicken too.. but beyond that, me and my bf find it hard to venture further. He's pretty stuck on the Cuban too. It's not the absolute best sandwich in the world necessarily, as this town is not lacking spots, but the special Cuban flavorings+ extra crispy crunchy bits of fried belly with just the right amount of grease light  +perfect light dusting of salty +convenience of proximity... ok so I am absurdly rav right now, no bkfst yet, need to food shop and waiting impatiently for 11a lunch menu to start...  but still I'm only exaggerating slightly.... for today as with most days, it is give me Cuban or give me death..

And peeps are super nice there too, they insisted on cooking a fresh batch of sandwiches when I was really late for a pickup order the other day.. rare... tho wouldn't blame them if they ate it;) i just truly hope biz has picked up as they should not ever close shop until we've agreed where to move together next! ps:not promoting pork eating as the piggies are damn cute and smart! Intellect of a 3yr human supposedly... so sorry, I will try to abstain.. i will try not to be a weak human....hmmm...uh oh..stomach grumble...
author: Carmenchu C.

description:
Three words: bacon maple scone 

Best thing ever!!!!!! Like a biscuit. So happy this place joined the hood. Can't wait to go back. Dangerous at my bus stop :)
author: PK R.

description:
What can I say about Bacon Bacon? A+

I'll start off by recommending the burger, grilled cheese and breakfast sandwich as my three classic favorites. The Mexican hot chocolate with chocolate-covered bacon is a must-have on a rainy day. Also, they bake some heavenly bacon cheddar scones, so grab one by the cash register before you leave.

Here are some fun tips to enhance your Bacon Bacon experience: Try all the different bacon bouquet flavors! Chicken fried is amazing, but you can never go wrong with maple. Ask them what the Giant Giant Bacon Bacon Burger Burger is, too. It'll make your day. Or break your heart, if you're a calorie counter.

This little spot in the Haight is great for brunches and dates. Bring your bros and girls here, and they will appreciate you for it. How can you not love everything about this place? Especially the Wall of Bacon. Jim, Tom and rest of the crew make the atmosphere so fun and incredible that you just want to set up camp here forever. Keep up the great service, you guys, and God bless America.
author: Ines C.

description:
On my first day in SF, I woke up jet lagged and, most importantly, starving. A quick search on Yelp lead me to nearby Bacon Bacon, which was simply serendipitous since I was badly craving some porky goodness. 

My bf and I entered the tiny eatery already knowing what to order: the breakfast burrito. Though seemingly small in size, it is packed to the brim with scrambled eggs, avocado, cheese, bacon and, the piece de resistance; pork shoulder. One hearty bite and I was in bacon heaven. A few bites later I spotted bottles of hot sauce (Sriracha & a mexican brand) and couldn't resist the urge to add some spice to the meat bonanza.

Keep in mind that the place is very small, with limited seating. We went on a late Saturday morning and had to wait around 10min for space to free up and it did get pretty crowded. 

I definitely plan on making a few more visits to Bacon Bacon (either the B&M location or the food truck) to try more menu items. I'm especially looking forward to the bacon flight!
author: Elsa K.

description: I wouldn't say the breakfast was anything too special. I'm not really sure why it cost so much either. We ordered to go because the inside was full and just over 20 minutes later we had our food. So this place is not super quick if you're in a hurry.
author: Tanner B.

description: Favorite spot in the neighborhood. I get my morning coffee here and order greasy breakfast food for my weekend hangovers. The porky fries, breakfast burrito and the daily special, which is a cuban sandwich, are delicious! But the real treat, in my opinion, is the bacon fried chicken sandwich. Bacon Bacon is a local treasure and just a gem.  Delicious food, nice folks, great sense of humor. Stop by their storefront if you're in the area - yummy sandwiches, great bacon, everything I have tried so far has been wonderful! Bring by your friends and family, I'm sure they'll love it!! Don't take my word for it, just have a look at their other reviews and you'll see that this small  restaurant is a gem.
author: Alicia R.

description: We had some great eats here during the S.F. Beer Festival.  We ordered the Bacon fried chicken sandwich + porky fries + chocolate  covered  bacon....it was simply awesome!!!!
author: Alex ..

description: The breakfast burrito with bacon AND pork shoulder is wonderful.  The first bite melting in your mouth is divine! Totally worth the calories.
author: J D.

description: Awesome food! Great service! And really good price point for what they're selling!! I definitely will come back when I'm in the bay area again :)
author: Lorene C.

description: I wish everyone could taste their bacon cookie it's truly savory goodness! It was the only thing I tried here but if the food is as amazing you'd be in bacon heaven.
author: Lauren A.

description: I consider myself a dedicated bacon lover. I am always looking for places that share my appreciation for bacon as its own food group. Bacon-Bacon is a dream come true where I enjoyed the best BLT with goat cheese and topped it off with a Mexican hot chocolate. Maybe in the future they will find a way to add bacon to the hot chocolate. Trying to show some restraint, I didn't try the maple bacon slices, guess I will have to come back another time. This place is truly great.
author: Jillian P.

description:
Breakfast burrito was tiny, but delicious.  Stuffed with tender pulled pork, eggs, avocado (which is the only reason i ordered it - worth it), red bell peppers?, and of course, bacon.  Leaning a TAD on the salty side, but let's be honest, that's all some people (me) want in a breakfast burrito: hearty, salty goodness.

Also tried the fried chicken sandwich.  The flavor had a real "je ne sais quoi" to it.  As in, there's no way I could replicate the flavor at home.  It was tender, and the bread was outstanding.

Would definitely eat here again.
author: chelsea c.

description:
It's hard to beat an eatery that focuses on bacon and delivers it in meals of high quality and thoughtful design. Our first go around with Bacon Bacon was via their mobile truck which has since burned to the ground (not a grease fire, but an engine fire. New one on the way we hear), and that was amazing. Amazing savory combinations, some with excellent spicy options. For me, it just did not get much better than that.

Now, visiting the store, the excellence continues. I had the the Hot Italian. My lady had the fried chicken sandwich. We split a side of Porky Fries.

Here's the thing: these sandwiches and the fries could have been served sans bacon in any other restaurant and they would have been MAGNIFICENT. But here, they are thoughtfully paired with bacon and their magnificence increases exponentially. 

If you like great lunch [or breakfast] food at a reasonable price, the Bacon Bacon is worth a visit. If you like great lunch [or breakfast] food at a reasonable price and also love bacon, THEN YOU MUST VISIT.
author: Stephen R.

description:
Best breakfast sandwich in SF. Need I say more?  

Oh, good coffee and friendly staff too.
author: JT N.

description: First time here and I am so amazed by all the bacon here! Parking was easy to find, the store is partially behind a tree. Coffee here is great, I'd recommend it to people looking for a small cafe. If you can handle the bacon smell, you're in the clear!
author: Emily M.

description:
egg. pork shoulder. bacon. avocado. cheddar. 

the best breakfast burrito I've ever had
author: Anthony A.

description: I went to the food truck at off the grid. I had been looking forward to trying this place for a long time. I ordered the burger and fries. Unfortunately, they forgot the bacon jam and cheese on my burger. So it just tasted like an over cooked burger with bacon on it. Also, the fries were supposed to come with Parmesan and herbs. But they were just limp fries. Maybe you would have a better experience at the restaurant.
author: Kenzie T.

description:
Oh My!  A restaurant called Bacon Bacon?  Of course it's a win and perfectly logical excuse to venture out into the city!

Let me give you a little secret in which I hope the owners do not mind me sharing!   (Slightly creeping into your personal space and whispering with a low voice) They also have a "secret menu" that isn't published on the board.  

It's a good thing that we found this out!  My boyfriend ordered the Bacon Bacon Bacon burger (yes, three bacon in a row!).  That massive burger was huge!  My poor boyfriend trying to eat that large thing.  At least I know he has a pretty little mouth there.*  Joke lang, joke lang!  Of course he loved it as I did with my Hot Italian Burger.  As soon as I got that little bastered in front of me, I was saddened with how fast it came and went.  Pork belly was too good to believe!  

I'm really surprised that this place didn't get slammed busy considering that it's location is so close to haight / ashberry street.  But then again I think the lack of other customers at that moment we arrive was in our favor since we had no clue on what to order.  The guy at the register (who I can only assume to be the owner)  gave us a little informative run down on their different burgers (Much needed and greatly appreciated!) 

A must do if you're on the prowl for a new taste!
author: Lea M.

description: As a bacon lover I had high expectations but unfortunately during this visit the bacon fried chicken sandwich was overcooked and the fries were hard and bland. A disappointing experience in this instance
author: Ray H.

description:
Oh dear goodness, this place is absolutely amazing.  I'd heard about the truck, but when I realized how close it was to my apartment, I hightailed it over to their kitchen.  My friend and I arrived too early for their lunch menu, so we tried a breakfast sandwich.  Wow was it amazing.  I don't typically eat breakfast sandwiches, but this one was worth it.  We also took a maple bacon scone for the road. Best. Idea. Ever. Do yourself a favor and get one.

Another day I decided it was in my best interest to try the Bird.  Bacon, panko encrusted chicken breast, spicy slaw and bacon mayo on a brioche bun. Holy crap this thing was amazing. I recognize that it wasn't the healthiest choice I've ever made, but you only live once!

The prices are right and the food is amazing.  The gentleman behind the counter was happy to answer all of my awkward questions and even make a joke or two.  If you like Bacon, which I know you do, go over there and devour some.
author: Michelle K.

description: First day off for holiday vacation, best friend in town and she's craving a breakfast burrito.  I say let's try some place new, and off we go to Bacon Bacon.   Each ordered up a burrito which was HUGE, hot and tasty.   Topped mine off with an Americano while she had a delish Mexican Hot Chocolate.   You cannot go wrong with a bacon burritto during the holidays.
author: Beth J.

description:
I am saddened about this review.
The LGBT was super bland. I added a fried egg for only $1 which was nice and to my surprise it had a runny yolk because I forgot to mention over medium. You should make note though cause not everybody likes that.  I winded up salting the drippy egg and dipping my sandwich in it with utter disappointment. 
I did not count the slices of back  like another yelper  did but it seemed like enough. The tomatoes were not ripe and there was not a whole lot of goat cheese. The lettuce was plentiful and fresh and the roll was crispy and perfect. It was just like dry, needed more goo. Like mayo first and then goat cheese. Or shoot maybe a mayo spread already mixed. The bacon itself was not hardly salty and I am now thinking that was the problem.
I didn't even hesitate when I saw the name  Bacon Bacon. I thought everything would be amazing. I would try it again but highly unlikely that I would be around there. I should have done the sandwich with the jam.
Surprisingly disappointed. :(
author: Rene V.

description: I love bacon and who doesn't. the food is innovative M pretty good. although I've had better. to me it feels like the passion of this food truck has dwendrled a way.  I always fine the people who work for bacon bacon to be very unfriendly. they support and attitude as well. it's too bad because it's a great idea and could be good food for great food and it slowly die
author: C D.

description: I went in the morning for the breakfast burrito, came across the food truck on Fishermans' Wharf and decided to have the fries. Both were very delicious.
author: C B.

description: Impressive. I've been to the Bacon Bacon truck before, but it's nice to go to the brick and mortar store as well. Definitely will be back.
author: Martha M.

description: Very tasty but it is a little pricey. I got the burger and herb fries. I only wish that the burgers came with the usual tomato lettuce etc. It doesn't really need them bc it's so flavorful but that's just my personal taste. The meat seemed good quality and the guy at the front was very friendly
author: Pilar J.

description:
*everything about bacon done right*
#pork
#50shadesofbacon

"Order quietly, Steph has a hangover", said the sign in front, and I completely agreed with it due to my cocktail flu. However from my parking spot 2 blocks away, the strong aroma of pork gently revived me until I was standing in front of the store. 

This place is exactly what you'd expect from a place called Bacon Bacon. Think any sandwich, burrito, salad, ice cream sandwich, whatever with a nice thick slice of bacon. This is no Denny's 1/16" think slice of bacon, but a solid hefty meal in itself. For the purists, you can order a "bouqet" of bacon which is exactly what you think it is. 

I ordered the bacon burrito which albeit small, had a generous serving of avocado in it. And as if there wasn't enough pork, there was shredded pork shoulder in the breakfast burrito that was cooked and simmered to the point of melting in my mouth. 

My friend's sandwich was a little bit dry, but no worries, we got a side of baconnaise with big fat bacon chunks in it. 

To top it off they had some great coffee to settle all the bacon you just consumed. A great place and great menu for bacon enthusiasts and casual bacon-ners. Could use some seating, oh and maybe leave a bottle of the bacon hot sauce for all to try!
author: Kevin T.

description: Bacon fried chicken sandwich,  porky fries,  Bacon infused chocolate chip cookies... Direct hit.
author: Fred S.

description:
I have been dying to try Bacon Bacon after seeing them on a couple of food specials.  I went to Bacon Bacon for breakfast this morning and I was in bacon heaven.  I love my bacon!  I had the breakfast sandwich, maple bacon scone with bacon jam, and a their drip coffee.  Everything was absolutely delicious!  The bacon jam was a pleasant surprise and is inspiring me to learn how to make it myself but I'm sure it won't be as good as Bacon Bacon's.
