Their kitchen/storefront is small with little seating, so you will most likely have to take your meal to go or stand and eat at the counters.  The place was very clean and the staff are friendly.  It was worth the drive from Walnut Creek.  For all you bacon lovers, this place is a must.
author: Mary K.

description:
As this is my first yelp review, I feel obliged to confirm to the standard of an unnecessary and overly personal intro. Feel free to skip ahead to the fourth paragraph, I will not know and have a strong constitution anywho.

My Aunt visits weekly from Berkeley, where she lives at the corner of University and Milivia, top apartment. Now about that Aunt. She recently finished dental school, bottom five percent of her class, but hey everyone who walks is called a dentist (right?!). She also suffers from crippling agoraphobia which, to make a long story short, keeps us local when we want to eat out. Bacon-Bacon's kitchen is just around the corner and it has become our go to place. You might find their cuisine at one of the many food truck gatherings around the city, as the majority of their food is slung via truck, but if you didn't know, they also have a kitchen in Ashbury Heights.

As a local I've had time to sample the entire menu. If you are a vegetarian, you might want to just sulk your way down to Haight Street, as the only vegetarian option is a parfait (I think... now I'm questioning my knowledge of the menu... look what are doing to me veggie-lovers, I hope you are happy!). But if you do eat meat you like bacon, and you've come to the right place.

Now, for the omnivores who are reading on, enough with autobiographical nonsense, let's talk about the food. The bacon in each dish is always perfectly cooked. Their kitchen is consistent. Each dish is also clever, some might call it a "foodie" take on bacon-y comfort food. But I'm not calling it that. Don't put too much thought into what you order, as everything is excellent. If possible order extra, or with a buddy or two split your order so you can get a good sampling of as many dishes as possible.

That said, I do have favorites. For breakfast I love their standard bacon and egg sandwich. Quick warning, be prepared to manage the tasty egg yolk as you take your first bites, it can cause some difficulty if you aren't anticipating it. Also, you really need to order a maple bacon scone. If you have been there before and haven't had one, go ahead and punch yourself in the face (or do something nonviolent that will help you remember next time) as you have been missing out on bacon awesomeness. This is the best scone I have ever had; all other scones should be ashamed of themselves.

For lunch, I usually mack on their LGBT (best sandwich name ever). It's like a BLT, but it has goat cheese to complete the flavor profile and clever name. Or I go for their pastrami sandwich. It has a run of the mill name, pork belly, pastrami, cheese, and an olive red pepper relish that brings it a whole nother plane of kick-buttness. 

To top it all off, they have great customer service. They are friendly, cook everything to order, and routinely serve excellent meals. I am a big fan of this place, and so is my Aunt. I give it my overwhelming endorsement.
author: Mac B.

description: The best breakfast in San Fran! They're bacon is perfectly thick cut, crispy, and a hint of maple sweet!!! Yum!!!!
author: Dani L.

description: I love Bacon! so I was really excited about trying this place. It lived up to all the hype that I heard from my friends. I had the bacon burger and fries. The burger had a great flavor and the bacon was cooked perfectly. I'm not a huge fries person but the fries were delicious. The staff was very friendly and talked with us for a while. I really wish there was one close to where I live because it would be a regular stop for me.
author: Dave C.

description: Never disappoints. Consistently amazing every time. The Almost Veggie Sandwich is a mixture of always perfectly fresh bread, sautéed veggies, a fried egg (slightly runny) and, of course, bacon. Try the Bouquet for your fill of crispy bacon every time. Even excellent coffee and a sunny, relaxing atmosphere. Go out of you way for Bacon, Bacon!
author: Andre M.

description: Tried the breakfast burrito.  It was delicious on the greasy side and I really only should have eaten half, but I have to say I thought it was one of the best I've had.
author: Diana E.

description: We got the cheddar bacon scone, LGBT sandwich, latte and brew and everything was delicious! On top of that, service was great. Would def return.
author: Ana R.

description: Just tried the Burger today was like an orgasm for my mouth this place just keeps getting better.  So far everything I've had is excellent and the people who work there are so friendly and upbeat love it.  They also just stared a new event at El Rio called Bacon Babes and Bingo went to the first one and loved it was a blast, I think I was like the only straight girl there but was a lot of fun.
author: Nirea S.

description: Bacon makes everything better. I'm guessing that's what they were going for here. Great breakfast frittata, flavorful scones, cookies were a little too salty with the dark chocolate and bacon, but I can see how some people would love it. Cute shop with friendly staff, not a bad stop if you're looking for something to eat on the go.
author: T P.

description:
Did not meet expectations.  Bacon Bacon has been on my radar for some time...it was tough to chase down truck locations...it became my "great white whale" for over a year!  But when a friend told me they opened a store in the Haight (not far from the office), I jumped at the chance to finally try it out...and so did my fellow co-workers.  It was a new experience for all of us, so we ordered 2 types of sandwiches:  Burgers and the LGBT.  The pics of the burger were very enticing....the LGBT description stated that each sandwich would have 5 slices of bacon.  

When we got our food...man, the overwhelming consensus was disappointment.  The burgers and LGBT's we're plain tasting and the breads used were Grocery Outlet quality.  Each of the LGBT's had a maximum of 3 slices of bacon...WTH???

I will not be returning anytime soon....what a let down!
author: Rodney B.

description: Not too much of a sit down place but the food is amazing! best Bfast burrito I've had in the city so far. I've also had their belly sandwich... totally worth all the pimples that came along with it! Great prices aswell!!
author: David L.

description: Very yummy. Quiet location.  Neighbors are upset about all the traffic to this isolated spot so be quiet while munching on your delicious menu item.
author: April M.

description:
I had possibly the best breakfast sandwich of my life from this place yesterday!  I moved a block and a half away from this little gem a couple months ago and I can't believe I waited so long to stop in.
The handwritten sign kind of turned me off from checking it out I think... felt temporary/makeshift (get a real one, guys!).
I ordered the breakfast sandwich.  Ingredients are: Bacon, fried egg, cheddar, bacon jam, brioche bun - $7
It typically comes with an egg over easy but I substituted scrambled eggs as I'm not a fan of runny yolk.  
All I can say is this breakfast sandwich is heaven!  You can tell the ingredients are all the best possible.  All of the ingredients compliment each other perfectly.  The bacon is thick and cooked perfectly.  Not rubbery or overly cooked.  The bacon jam gives the sandwich a slight sweetness and makes it even richer.

They have great coffee too, which is a nice surprise.  I love a full - bodied cup o' Joe and it's hard to find around these parts (La Boulange has good coffee but it's a little bit of a walk).  

Hugh was working and was super accomodating, nice and helpful.  Looking forward to my next breakfast sandwich!  They also have bacon scones which are very intriguing.
author: Alisa M.

description:
*On our quest to try 52 places in 52 weeks*

SO MUCH BACON. Bacon overload. But in a good way. I am not a die-hard bacon fan (I know), but of course, I appreciate it just as much as the next person. The hubs however LOVES bacon and this spot is in our neighborhood (Cole Valleyyyyy) so we sauntered over on a Saturday morning before college football. The hubs got some sort of Bacon Burrito (which had more pork belly than bacon, but still delicious according to him) and I had The Croissant with Bacon Jam...which was..,interesting. I mean, I signed up for bacon, right? And it was bacony! 

I would love to come back for lunch and the Oakland roasted coffee was delish!
author: Melissa N.

description: Breakfast burrito is top notch, especially if you're looking for a meatier option. It does not include breakfast potatoes (which I typically like to have in my breakfast burritos) but the pork shoulder and bacon are quality meats and the avocado, cheddar cheese and peppers add some great flavors too.
author: Charles F.

description: Delicious food, difficult to choose from all the options. Their fries with pork belly was great. Highly recommended
author: Burak G.

description:
Items ordered:
1. The breakfast sandwich
2. The almost vegetarian breakfast sandwich

The reason for the low ranking is that both sandwiches were remarkably bland. The only flavor that comes through on the regular breakfast sandwich is a mild hint of the bacon syrup. While this is a nice flavor, it is quickly absorbed by the cardboard (brioche) bun.

The almost vegetarian sandwich is similarly dominated by one flavor, but in this case it is the broccolini doing the heavy lifting. With a little salt to balance the bitterness of the broccolini and more red peppers to add sweetness, this sandwich could be improved. However, the floppy, flavorless brioche bun ends up sucking any life out of the sandwich, so like it or not, the flavor disappears anyway.
author: John D.

description: The problem with a place like this is that I literally want to eat everything on the menu.  Since that was impossible, I went with either the fried chicken sandwich or the pulled pork sandwich.  One I got and one I dreamed I was able to get.  As I write this, I wonder why I have not been back.  Sorry, I need to run somewhere...
author: Jeremy G.

description: Bacon goodness and nice service. They forgot bacon in my bf's breakfast sandwich and remade him another one just heaping with bacon & bacon jam. I had the breakfast wrap - tortilla filled with bacon, pork shoulder, avocado and cheese. Filling, hot, hearty, delicious. They have iced coffee, blueberry lemonade, orange juice, etc.
author: Sonya Z.

description: Happy place to stop for a bite. I ordered a sandwich, it was good and the guys were really friendly. I will definitely go back.
author: Armando A.

description: As soon as you walk in the door the smell is intoxicating and makes your mouth water, the restaurant is homely and clean, the menu of delectable bacon goods is amazing, if you like bacon this place will make you love it, I met the owner last time I was here and he was incredibly polite and showed great hospitality, the staff on my second visit was just as professional and pleasant, 5 stars no question.
author: M. W.

description:
I used to have recurring dreams about a world made of bacon.  Bacon Bacon is a step in the right direction of making my dreams a reality.  

Bacon is good.

They have a lot of it here. 

Including bacon breakfast dishes, bacon lunch dishes and bacon desserts.

Enough said.  Come get yo bacon.
author: Amy N.

description: What a great little spot! If you enjoy the truck, you will enjoy the kitchen more.  All of your favorites are here, plus much much more, including an espresso bar.  On my visit I happened upon a Saturday special - bacon-wrapped chicken sliders! Delicious! Their regularly featured chicken sandwich is wonderful as well.  I'm not often in this area, but Bacon Bacon will be a target for me when I am.  Highly recommended & reasonably priced!
author: Andy S.

description: Bacon Bacon was all I expected! Try the Bacon Fried Chicken Sandwich! Great service too and definitely ride the piggie
author: Melissa A.

description: Stop reading this immediately!!! Go to bacon bacon and order the best breakfast burrito on this planet!!! What are you doing!!! Your wasting time, you could have been there by now being worshipped on the altar of your tastebuds!!!!!!  Hurrrrrrryyy!!!!
author: RD r.

description:
I brought my bacon-bewitched boyfriend to Bacon Bacon for his birthday brunch and it was beyond belief! Our best bite? The Bacon Bouquet! This was a flight of each of their bacon preparations including: chimichurri, bbq, breaded & deep fried, and candy (brown sugar bacon). We were less excited by the LGBT (BLT with goat cheese) and Bacon Grilled Cheese that we shared, but want to go back to try the Bacon Burger and another flight of bacon. This was the first time that I ever saw my boyfriend so satiated with bacon that he was unable to finish it. 
I was sad to hear that their food truck burned, but I look forward to visiting that once they get a new one running.
author: Kris B.

description: poor service at lunch time. They prefer to prepare the orders to go that they had over the phone than serving you.
author: F Q.

description: Fantastic from start to finish. My kids actually made nom-nom sounds while eating the Cuban sandwich, which was hot, oozing with cheese and pork juices and goodness.
author: Nevada L.

description:
I came here with my good buddy and my little baby for lunch the other day. I walk past this place every day with my kid thinking, "Huh. Another eatery *obsessed* with bacon. I guess I'd eat here but...eh."

Long story short, we tried it and it was amazing. Really top notch, fresh food, prepared well and not at all leaning on a gimmick. I had the Italian sandwich and my friend had the Club. We split the pork fries. The Italian was delicious: warm, crispy, moist and really focused on the flavor of pork belly cut with cheese and arugula. The pork fries were intense, covered in bacon chunks, peppers and...pulled pork (I think). It was rich but not overly so, incredibly tasty without being too salty, and almost too much food for two hearty eaters.

My daughter chowed on her quinoa and carrots (she doesn't gnaw at pig like papa), we made a huge mess and the owner was totally cool with it. Thank you SO much for being chill with us and for the tasty lunch. This is probably the best place to have lunch in the Haight.
author: Alee K.

description:
Saved my bacon.
Moved to the hood and could NOT find a cup of coffee on a Saturday morning that didn't involve a line or the lack of cash (only had plastic).
Just as I had given up I walked by Bacon Bacon where they allowed me to buy a coffee with a CC (usually places have minimums) but then I saw the scone.....and it changed my life.
The coffee is rich and wonderful.  
The scone is unreal! The perfect mix of savory and sweet thanks to the bacon chutney. It was a food moment.
author: J H.

description:
My love affair with bacon has truly begun.
I think i may just become a regular here yet.
As it was my first time visiting Bacon Bacon i asked what was good, and received the breakfast sandwich. Mind. Blown.
author: Genni V.

description: Truck is better. The cook is not accommodating and punitive. Staff is nice other than that. Will return when there's a different cook.
author: Christine M.

description: Bacon Bacon is an unexpected treat:  an island of indulgence amid a sea of residences.  This location houses the kitchen and operations of the vaunted Bacon Bacon food truck.  I marvel at the delicious sandwiches and breakfast treats here, particularly the bacon scone, croissant with bacon jam, and the ultimate breakfast sandwich (featuring an egg over easy, bacon, cheddar, and bacon jam on a toasted yet fluffy brioche bun).  The "almost veggie" breakfast sandwich -- comprised of scrambled egg with broccoli rabe, roasted red pepper, bacon, and melted provolone between a toasted brioche bun -- comes close to assuaging my guilt for eating here.  But perhaps that would be asking for too much.
author: Chris T.

description: Meh. Neither dish I had (the grilled cheese and the porky fries -- which is fries with bacon, pork shoulder, and cheese) was particularly memorable. A little too greasy, a little too much bread (yes, even for a bacon place).
author: Gabe E.

description: The staff here are super friendly.  My friend is a bacon lover and was excited to go and see what they had.  She got the chocolate covered bacon and loved it.  They also had tshirts to purchase.  It was my birthday and they gave me a free treat and took a picture of me on the mechanic pig to put on their wall.  On the other hand there was obviously no options for my vegan friend at Bacon Bacon!
author: Julie W.

description: First time here and the food was amazing!   The breakfast burrito was delicious and my son had a hamburger that was juicy and super delicious.    Will come again for sure!
author: Karen G.

description: Great food at great prices. This is our go-to neighborhood breakfast nook every weekend. The breakfast burrito is a tasty tube of pork, but if you're not hungry enough to handle it, the taco is a tasty alternative.
author: Niels ..

description: Just got into town, my brother took me to bacon bacon and good god, it is fantastic. I sampled a number of dishes as I had already technically eaten breakfast. But I couldn't resist. Giant pulled pork, egg, bacon, avocado and cheese burrito was fantastic, the pork well cooked and everything just glommed together perfectly. The breakfast sandwich was probably the best, delicious bread and I really appreciated the runny egg for some dipping. The folks working there, especially some fellow known as "Daddy" were super friendly and we were even given a cheeseburger to try for free. Thick slices of bacon, again w delicious poppy-seed bun, was surprisingly easy to eat considering the feast we had just sampled. Oh, and the coffee options are outstanding. Bacon Bacon and the great folks that work there got my weekend off to an ideal start.
author: Jacob C.

description: Quick foodies and service is ok. Get the breakfast burrito! Half of it was cold, oddly. Do not get the breakfast burger-- it's tiny and not as yummy.
author: Cat C.

description: SO GOOD! we got the breakfast burrito, the fried chicken sandwich, and the Bird - everything was amazing! great flavors without being too salty or "fatty" tasting. friendly and great service - can't wait to go again and try more things!
author: Hannah H.

description: Great food.  I had the Belly sandwich twice (my favorite) and the bacon, chocolate cookie.  I also recommend the Bacon Chicken Sandwich.  The staff and cashier are very friendly.  Try it! Can't wait to go back and try more items off their menu.
author: Logan B.

description: I went for lunch, the sandwich I had was eh, fried chicken and bacon and slaw....nothing to write home about, the fried chicken was pretty dry, but it sounds like they're known for their breakfast.
author: S M.

description: Wow spectacular flavors. First visit and throughly enjoyed a breakfast burrito and Mexican hot chocolate supercharged with espresso. I may need to make sure I walk here because this is habit forming.
author: Manny R.

description: Great chicken sando.but a Cubano that isnt grilled not a fan.
author: Russ H.

description: A joyful surprise as we wandered from Corona Heights to NoPa our first morning visiting relatives for thanksgiving. I jumped in with the breakfast burrito - a cornucopia of goodness anchored by pork shoulder and highlighted by avocado and pickled peppers. L opted for the very extra special veggie frittata on bed of bacon bacon with sliced tomatoes and greens. Three days later I woke in a post-holiday fog pondering bacon and ventured out in the city clouds to gather another burrito from this little protein haven. I am truly thankful.
author: Andrew A.

description: Stopped by Bacon Bacon while in SF for the weekend at the recommendation of my boyfriend. I visited the physical location in Ashbury and had a delicious breakfast burrito. I love pork shoulder and was excited to see it included in the burrito so I had to get it - it did not disappoint. Many of the yelp reviews warned of the lack of seating in the cafe but we went around 2pm and there was plenty of seating at the window barstools. I can see how it can get crowded though if you go at peak hours. Later in the day we were at Outside Lands and saw that the Bacon Bacon food truck was there. It had quite a line so I'm glad we were able to go to the cafe beforehand and avoid the crowds.
author: Denise V.

description:
bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon, bacon.....come here for some tasty bacon centric sandwiches.  the grilled cheese and the cblt were tasty!  

they have coffee too, bacon for breakfast, lunch, dessert and even bacon flights.  portions are generous on each sandwich and the sandwich itself is very filling.  

delicious, tasty bacon!
author: Caesar R.

description: Bacon Bacon staff has behaved rudely to me and others. I cannot recommend anyone visiting this establishment.
author: Ej M.

description: Cuban sandwich was fuego! Great service too. Would def. come back next time I'm in sf.
author: Jake D.

description: I REALLY wanted to like this place because I LOVE bacon but unfortunately had a sad experience. I don't remember the name of the sandwich that I got but it was basically fried chicken wrapped in bacon, sounds amazing right? Well unfortunately the way they cooked it, the underside of the bacon was completely uncooked... whhiicch kind of made me nauseous. *sigh* However, I will say that the bacon grilled cheese and the bacon jam were FABULOUS. So maybe get those to be on the safe and still really amazing side. I will definitely go back just for that grilled cheese.
author: Melanie M.

description: good food, terrible service.... I ordered from here via UberEats today @ 2:55 (closing time listed as 3 pm)... They rejected the order around 3:10... I called UberEats customer service and they told me that you have to order well in advance of "closing time" to get your order - like an HOUR ahead of time... Okay, then just list "closing time" at 2 pm... Is that so hard??
author: Liz M.

description: Small menu and almost everything has some type of bacon ingredient. I like places with small menus as that means they can focus on making a few things really well. Bacon bacon does a decent job at that and I very much enjoyed what I got (breakfast burrito and a croissant with bacon jam). That said, I felt like I didn't get enough of their namesake in my food. The rate of bacon was overwhelmed by everything else.
author: Josh S.

description:
I have eaten there the past 2 Thursdays and on both occasions sandwiches have not been good. 

They have changed the menu in the cafe. 

The old bird sandwich:
Turkey, Chicken Fried Bacon, Provolone, Cole Slaw and Avocado on Soft French Roll.

The new bird sandwich:
Turkey, Bacon, Cole Slaw, Hard Dry Stale French Roll toasted in a panini maker.  No cheese, No avocado.  And really dry.  

I also tried the Cubano sandwich.  It was a bunch of meats with a slice of cheese on a hard dry roll toasted in a panini maker.  

Maybe its the sandwich maker that works on Thursday.  I don't know but I won't go back for a while. Sorry.
author: Samantha J.

description: Service was fantastic - super friendly! My husband loved the breakfast burrito & the almost veggie sandwich was to die for, especially on the toasted brioche. We also picked up two chocolate chip bacon cookies on a whim-- delicious! If we lived in the area we would definitely make this a (terrible) habit.
author: Savannah K.

description: I love visiting this location cause they have more to offer on the menu over the truck and the mission street location. Before this one closed I would come often and the place looks nice. My food was made to order and wow the food was AMAZING. I recommend trying everything on the menu every visit you get. This isn't a grab and go food that eat in five minutes. This is art that you sit down for 30 minutes take a bite and enjoy it.
author: San F.

description: God bless America. Only in America is it possible to have a cafe menu where 1/3 of the items are just various ways to prepare strips of bacon: maple, chicken fried, regular bacon, and 4 others I can't recall. One order of The Flight bouquet (a sampling of their 7 preparations for bacon strips) is a heart attack waiting to happen according to a calorie counter, that puts the entire order equivalent to one day's worth of sodium and over a day's worth of saturated fat. There are real food items for breakfast and lunch but given that I already ate 6 strips of bacon (left one for tomorrow to demonstrate restraint), I figure that I should give Bacon Bacon a least a week's rest. My only qualm is that they close at 3 pm. Who says a bacon craving can be limited to only the mornings and afternoons?!?!
author: Gwen L.

description: Enjoyed it.  The ham and cheese croissant was delicious and the burger was too.  I'd go back and suggest others try it too.
author: Kris C.

description: I been there 2 weeks ago. It was sunday we went for late breakfast but the bread is not fresh also there is nothing special with bacon wrapped chicken. Do not waste your time. Simple. They are just trying show different.  there is nothing special.
author: Emre E.

description: It's bacon! Onomonomon.....bacon! I came here with my friends and wow hands down. I loved the bacon fried chicken. I could not stop eatting it. It was getting better at every bite. I was left fulfilled and satisfied.The spicy mama bacon :)....ummmmm yummy.
author: Thu L.

description:
Went there today with a friend and his infant daughter for lunch, still feeling the after effects but was it ever worth it. I got the Bird, which had turkey, chicken fried bacon (oh yeah), avocado and purple cabbage. It was meaty, filling and delicious. I also shared an order of the fries which had pulled pork, bacon and hot peppers on it. It was a guilt-inducing amount of food and calories, but again, worth it. 

The space is clean and welcoming (though a bit small) and it required a lot of hill climbing to get there, but that's probably a good thing considering the food. The staff was incredibly friendly as well. My friend's daughter made a bit of a mess, spilling some food on the floor, and they didn't bat an eye, just thanked us for coming by. 

Will definitely be heading back there soon to try out some of the other sandwiches.
author: Tae K.

description:
bacon all on my tongue 
bacon all in my guts
dont believe me just eat there 
hungry hungry hungry
dont believe me just eat there


all bacon errthang

get the mixed order that comes with all the different flavors you wont regret it
author: Cruz, J.

description: Is there something more than 5 stars I can give?  OMG, BACON !!!!!  This was our 2nd visit and my brother and I both got the bacon cheeseburgers, fantastic.  Parking is hard to find but work the effort.  Bacon Bouquets are the ultimate guilty pleasure.  I can't say enough about this place, you have to go.
author: Colleen J.

description: Sorry it took me so long to try this place out! Just had the best breakfast sandwich ever. Free double cappuccino (they are debuting their new machine) was beautiful. A most welcome addition to the neighborhood.
author: Joby P.

description: Holy pig, this is some damn good bacon!  Just the perfect thickness and amazing flavor.  I had a breakfast burrito which, while not the largest, it may have been the single most flavorful I've ever had.  I also tried the bacon scone, which was awesome as well.  The wife had a breakfast sandwich, which was just ok (besides the bacon in it, which was of course excellent).  My son got a regular bacon bouquet, which I proceeded to eat half of.  Did I feel like a giant greaseball afterwards?  Yes.  Do I regret it?  Not for a second.  The one thing I wasn't a huge fan of was the bacon jam.  But I guess you can't win 'em all.  I wish they'd drive one of their trucks down to So Cal!
author: Tim G.

description: Last sunday my friends and i went to go eat brunch at Zazie, but it was a nice day and it would have been at least an hr and a half wait and we didn't have that much time, so we happened upon Bacon Bacon. This is more of a counter eats place, or takeout, and obviously, it is full of bacon. They advertised some yummy looking mexican bacon hot chocolate, but they were out. They were also out of some tasty looking scones. They did have potato balls, which they'd just invented the thursday before. They were yum, made out of mashed potatoes fried with a little bacon inside. The guy said he's still perfecting the recipe, they were a work in progress, but tasted good to me! I must say, i'm not really a bacon fan, personally, but I just went because it was there and who knows it may have changed my taste buds and i just wanted to go with the flow. My friends had the pork belly breakfast sandwich and the almost vegetarian breakfast sandwich (which yes, has bacon) and enjoyed them. I also had the almost vegetarian. LOL it wasn't for me. I can vouch that it's good if you enjoy bacon but if not, it's my fault for being there. Fresh squeezed OJ was also thick and delish! The sandwiches were on the small side and my friends ended up sharing a dessert crepe elsewhere, so you may want to get your OWN potato balls with your sandwich instead of sharing them btwn 3. ppl. Friendly, fast service. It's a shame some neighbors are trying to shut them down. Rude! I hope they don't. If you love bacon, come here, breakfast and lunch sandos, plus flights of bacon.
author: Merredith L.

description: Great breakfast sandwich, best I can remember.  Easy, casual and quick.
author: Ian F.

description: I ordered the LGBT and was not too pleased with the result,  it was lacking in the  bacon department. Thank bacon  my bf ordered "the bird" and it was so delicious we will definitely be going back to try more items.
author: Monique H.

description:
Absolutely love this place!

The breakfast sandwich is incredible: the mixture of egg, bacon, cheese and whatever awesomeness they use for the bun consistently delivers a melt-in-the-mouth taste that is really hard to beat anywhere else.

The staff is super friendly and welcoming as well with fast service.

If you are in a hurry for a quick and delicious breakfast (or even if you are not in a hurry), this is the place to go.
author: Matt V.

description: how in heck did I just find you? You are delicious, I got the cobb salad which has bacon and pork belly in it, and oh man I'm in love with my taste buds right now. This place is excellent, great service, and next time I'm trying those PORKY FRIES!
author: Lauren V.

description: You can search for the truck around town or just walk right into the kitchen on Frederick. Flights of bacon are awesome. Some unique creations, but we tend to resort back to old faithful... original, w/ a drizzle maple syrup. Want more than a snack? Bacon fried chicken sandwich covered in slaw will satisfy. Hit up Tacos on Tuesdays too.
author: Eric W.

description: I have had a serious change of heart in regards to the Bacon Bacon location on Frederick, everything I mentioned in my hateful review before has changed! The menu no longer has five items only, and the coffee actually tastes like coffee, and the biggest difference is the customer service! They are actually HAPPY to see you and make you food (which has greatly improved)! In the end, I am very happy and excited to see this little neighborhood joint improving :)
author: Kelsea A.

description: Bacon is hot right now. It's an Internet meme; it's a running joke; a favorite morning side dish; a sandwich accoutrement and all around preferred flavor. It makes sense then, that someone somewhere would devise an entire food service around the concept of bacon. Bacon Bacon does not disappoint, with its succulent, satisfying meals, which, while all incorporating some bacon, are essentially quality deli market food with hearty ingredients and an inviting atmosphere to the establishment.
author: David S.

description:
I stumbled across this while looking for vegetarian friendly restaurants.

This is NOT for vegetarians by any means. As soon as you walk through the door, your senses are blasted with the aroma of delicious bacon. I was taken aback by the lack of seating in the establishment (I remember 4 stools in the entire seating area)

I had ordered the Hot Italian, and while it does not have any bacon strips in it. The sandwich itself was quite delicious with a generous serving of pork belly layered inside. On top of that, I had an order of pork belly fries. While the pork belly was indeed tasty and seasoned the fries just perfectly. The fries, themselves, seemed a tad stale.

My friend, on the other hand, ordered the Free Bird, which she complained was too dry and the bacon-fried bird lacked any taste of bacon.

Perhaps it was an off day for them or the fact that we did not order anything with a pure strip of bacon.

I am still intrigued to try other items on their menu, but in due time.
author: Jason N.

description: Bacon, bacon I am a fan.  I had the new chicken and bacon sandwich today...quite yummy but my favorite is still the bacon jam on the bacon scone!
author: lisa g.

description: I don't know who writes some of these reviews, but know one thing:  If you only "like" bacon you'll love this place.  However, if, like me, you love bacon it IS Nirvana!  And the friendly staff and ambiance are akin to having friends who let you eat the best bacon stuff right there on the premises!
author: David C.

description: Bought a burger from their food truck and found out that the bun has mold on it. YUCK. Stay AWAY!
author: D Z.

description:
Holy Cow!

Dropped in for lunch on Friday 3/1 and got the burger.  I can say that it is the best burger I have had in a long time.

I am not a regular but have been here a few times and everything I have tried has been really good.  Last time was the grilled cheese. Yum!  Oh, and I had these french fries with meat on them.  Way too much to eat at once but really good.

Staff is always friendly and I get in after the normal lunch rush so I can either stand or sit at the window counter.

Can't wait for the truck to be up and running!
author: Todd S.

description: heard on the news today that the neighborhood has rallied to get this place closed down due to the bacon smell.  wtf?  right, because the stench of piss and vomit wafting up from the haight ashbury is sooo much more appealing.  rock on bacon bacon!!  crash and burn ashbury yuppies!!!
author: howdy d.

description: You had me at 'bacon'. Anyone that DOESN'T give this place 5 stars must be a damn vegetarian.
author: Richard C.

description: breakfast burrito. so heavy. so delicious. porky awesome. would pass on the coffee next time, but there will definitely be a next time.
author: Andrew L.

description: OHHHHH MAAAAAN! After a long drive from LA, my girlfriend and I were on the search  for a place to grab breakfast.  While the line at Mama's was incredibly long, we just decided to come here. First of all, they did not disappoint with the food! The breakfast sandwich and burrito were AMAZING! Although I preferred the sandwich over the burrito. Way better than EGGSLUT in my book!
author: Frank H.

description: stopped by for a breakfast burrito before going camping, and it was bomb. it's a large breakfast burrito full of tons of pork should meat. Very filling and satisfying. My boyfriend got the breakfast sando, which was also worth buying.
author: Katherine W.

description: Likely the best breakfast sandwich in the history of the breakfast sandwich. Loved the almost veggie one (yes, it has bacon). Others had the regular breakfast sandwich with bacon jam (think pulled pork BBQ) and the burger. The 2-patty cheese burger with bacon and grilled onions was quite something. Delicious.
author: Margaret B.

description: I was staying with a friend who lives near Buena Vista park and was lucky to find this place for a late breakfast/lunch. I had the bahn mi one day and went back for the breakfast burrito the next. Both came out fast and were fantastic. Combine great food with great prices and super friendly staff and you've got a winner. Thanks Bacon Bacon, for keeping it real and knowing what it's all about.
author: John B.

description: Got lucky and arrived in time with no line, by the time our food came out the place was packed.  That was a big bonus.  We ordered the BBQ Pulled pork sandwich and the breakfast burrito, side of porky fries.  The sandwich was packed with three styles of pork, pulled, belly, and bacon.  The sauce was on the sweet side.  The roll nothing special but I didn't feel it was grocery store quality either.  Not the best pulled pork I've ever had, but definitely up there.  The breakfast burrito was very good.  Eggs nice and hot. Needed more avocado, would have paid more if I knew there would be so little.  The side of porky fries was ok, really the reason I couldn't stretch the review to be a five star, that and each item was good but not the best ever.  The fries were nice and crispy, but not enough of them.  The pork thrown in was a good sampling, but nothing really stood out.  Next time I'll just order the regular fries because I probably will get enough pork on the other menu items.
author: Andrew G.

description: This place is awesome.   We stop by the Frederick storefront as frequently as we can on weekends and are SO glad they're now open on Sundays!  Note - it's not always super easy to find parking around there, as it's smack in the middle of a residential neighborhood, but whatever - hop on the N line, take a bus, or circle the block because IT'S WORTH IT!   I'm a huge fan of the breakfast sandwich, which is an egg over easy with cheddar cheese, lots of delicious, thick-cut bacon, and bacon jam on the most delicious roll!   Never a fan of runny eggs, I order mine with scrambled and they have always been happy to oblige.   Bacon jam sounded weird at first, and admittedly, I did order the sandwich once without it, but never again.  It totally pulls the sandwich together and is delicious!     Otherwise, the bacon cheddar scone is also really good.  If you're a bacon connoisseur, you would probably enjoy the bacon bouquet, which is just a bunch of bacon, wrapped up together, ready to eat. :)   I have yet to go there for lunch, but the menu looks divine so it's on my list.  The storefront is teeny tiny, but there are stools and there's room to eat at the countertops.   It's not uncommon to see people standing outside with their friends, kids, and/or pups enjoying a delicious sandwich.   The staff are super friendly and overall, it's just a great experience.  Check it out!
author: Amy J.

description: OMG...I will never come here again...I've never had a Burger so dry and tasteless in my life, the Bacon had no flavor, the Arnold Palmer was tart,  my fries were ugly with a few flakes of parmesan and diced onions all for the low price of $14.00, never ever again, plus my coworker ordered the Vietnamese sandwich that had not shedded pork but a pork pattie that looked like cooked spam,lol disgusting, I've been belching up grilled onions all day!!!!
author: anita b.

description: if you're going to eat bacon why go to a place called 'sweet maple' on the other side of geary if you can stay in the haight and eat at a place called 'bacon bacon' seems logical but i practically came to blows with my companion that day who couldn't get clear in their heads what 'the other side of geary' meant.  anyway we kissed and made up and found parking right in front and walked into a relatively quiet restaurant at that odd hour around 1030am.  i got the brisket my friend got the meatloaf (with a 15 min wait so you know it was fresh fresh fresh) and it was yummy i have to tell you...my mother said if you can't cook and you choose to cook...wrap whatever comes out of the oven in bacon and they will love it...and this place does all that and doesn't even have too both the brisket and the meatloaf could stand alone but i say bring it on anyway what can it hurt.  Kim was behind the counter and she was all that answering questions and showing us the ropes this is one of those high tech places and I'm getting the hang of them and i like it especially when someone like Kim is there to show you how to touch the screen to pay the bill to collect the food while popping the fanta's non twist-able and showing us how the takeaway boxes work...she was very very smart and a big part of us having so much fun.   thanks Kim!
author: tom l.

description: Bacon Bacon is a local treasure.  Delicious food, nice folks, great senses of humor.  Hopefully they'll get their truck running again soon but in the meantime stop by their storefront if you're in the area - yummy sandwiches, great bacon, everything I've tried so far has been wonderful!
author: D W.

description: Favorite spot in the neighborhood.  Get my morning coffee here and greasy breakfast food for my weekend hangovers.  The burger, breakfast burrito and porky fries are delicious!
author: Eric A.

description: Bacon Bacon's web-presence via Yelp, Facebook, Twitter, the establishment's actual site, and other media outlets provide a body of messages and reviews that are not entirely on the same page. The questions raised by their virtual persona warrant further investigation. First and foremost, one might wonder how a restaurant survives in the organic/vegetarian/vegan obsessed food culture of San Francisco with a menu that is made up entirely of pork-based dishes. To answer this query, an initial introduction is provided by the company's website, baconbaonsf.com, where the clean and quirky aesthetic suggests a sensitivity to a design oriented market as well as their location in the famous Haight/Ashbury neighborhood. Based on these queues, an interested patron may guess that Bacon Bacon is more aligned with serving up novelty rather than just a greasy comfort food. The company's roots in the food truck tradition, where contradicting dishes, such as a pad-thai taco, might draw hordes of hungry diners, further re-enforces this deduction. Upon visiting Bacon Bacon at their physical space, customers are greeted with a boutique café, more hip coffee shop than gritty BBQ joint. The food it's self is very much in keeping with the image provided by the company. Although some reviewers suggest the fare is underwhelming, it is more accurate to describe the food as simple. According to general consensus, the dishes taste fresh and straightforward with the creative inclusion of some bacon-related feature to provide the restaurant's signature flair.  That is to say every aspect, from the warm maple-bacon scone, to the dainty track lighting, to the clean and simple website, ensures the entire experience provided by Bacon Bacon is satisfyingly cohesive.
author: Matthan C.

description: Terrific bacon.  Bad scones.  Like lead. Inedible.  Go for the bacon.
author: Yella W.

description:
wow, what a great sandwich. i got the chicken fried bacon turkey one with cole slaw . just a very nice experience. i highly recommend
 supporting this business, they are quality.
author: molly d.
